story:
Who We Are                                             

The Arab-American Family Support Center (AAFSC) is a non-profit, non-sectarian organization that empowers new immigrants with the tools they need to successfully acclimate to the world around them and become active participants in their communities. 

AAFSC was established in 1994 and is the first and largest Arabic-speaking social service agency in New York City. AAFSC has consistently expanded its programs to meet the needs of the Arab, Middle Eastern, Muslim and South Asian (AMEMSA) communities and we s​erve over 6,000 low-income people each year. 

                                            About Leen and Isabella 

Leen Shumman is a 16 year old Jordanian/Palestinian American who has an interest in social activism, especially within her own community. She has recently discovered how to use her personal voice and share her opinions through multimedia. Leen aspires to be a human rights attorney in the near future. 

Isabella Arroyo was born and raised in Brooklyn, NY. She is a rising senior at Khalil Gibran International Academy High School, where you’ll find her playing chess, coding, doing yoga and practicing Arabic. Throughout her time in high school, she's become the liaison for Principal's Advisory and Student Council, organized fundraising events, and founded a Peer-to-Peer Chemistry Group. Isabella spends her free time taking courses through College Now and Baruch STEP Academy, volunteering at the 9/11 Memorial Museum and Plaza, and working on science research papers alongside her mentor. 

Leen and Isabella have been given the opportunity to become youth fellows during the 2015-2016 school year at AAFSC through the generosity of the Brooklyn Community Foundation. During their fellowship they will take on a project to raise awareness about and help combat the issues of Islamophobia and gender-based violence within their respective communities.

                                     Why This Campaign Is Important

Having learned a great deal about community organizing and advocacy work, Leen and Isabella are hoping to attend the the National Network for Arab American Communities’ annual Arab American Youth Summit that will be taking place on November 7-8 in Dearborn, Michigan. This Summit will give Leen and Isabella the chance to further hone in on their organizing skills, outreach methods, and connect with other Arab American youth across the country to discuss various issues affecting their local communities and the national Arab American population at large. 

The Summit will allow Leen and Isabella to attend workshops dedicated to discussing problems such as racism, prejudice, Islamophobia, and intra-community issues like cultural and generational barriers. They will also learn the necessary tools to build successful campaigns, projects, and events dedicated to helping their communities.

Leen and Isabella will be putting together a documentary to shed light on the issues of Islamophobia and gender-based violence and these workshops will help them execute their plans. In addition, this summit will prove a significant networking opportunity for Leen and Isabella as they will be provided with the chance to meet and interact with adult community activists and professionals from all over the country.

                                                 

                                                    What We Are Asking For 

To make this possible, Leen and Isabella are asking for your support to collect $1500 that will cover the costs of airfare, housing, food, and the summit fee for that weekend. Help Leen and Isabella amplify their voices and take the work they have been doing in their local community to a higher level and allow them to reach out to a greater audience!

story:
Meet Grace

It has often been said that turning copper into gold is impossible. But what about converting human waste into profit? Many of the low-income areas in Dar-es-Salaam have problems disposing properly of their human waste. Grace has a solution. DAREnterprisers has been helping Grace create Rafiki Fertilisers, a social enterprise turning human waste into high-quality fertiliser which can be used to produce higher crop yields, feeding more people in the area.

 

Grace says: “I’ve learned the steps to form social enterprises; right from ideation to prototyping to presentation skills. DAREnterprisers has helped me develop my idea to become physically possible. I also now have a team to work with – a partner who is equally passionate and interested in the idea. We work as a team to make it possible – it’s exciting and fascinating to get that.”

 

Meet George

George is part of City Recycling Agent Centre, a team working on a social enterprise to clean up the streets of Tanzania’s low-income, often unplanned, settlements. The idea is simple: give local people employment by collecting and sorting plastic waste from their peers, and sell it on to larger recycling companies. Imagine Dar-es-Salaam being clean as never before, with no waste and lower crime rates due to higher employment. They will achieve this using innovative technology, alongside personal relationships with the community and local businesses. George says:

 

“DAREnterprisers has been very great – life transforming for me. I came to the course with a different business idea, but once I was taught about social enterprises I created a very new idea as I want to benefit the community as well as generate a profit. I hope this will make my business more sustainable in the long run. I came up with the idea when we went to Manzese [a low income area in Dar-es-Salaam] through empathising with the community. The best thing I love about the course is that it’s practical-we learn and then we practise it. Another thing I have learned is time management. I have never waited in class for facilitators to come, I normally find them in class waiting for us participants with a great smile, energy and enthusiasm that the day is going to be great full of productivity. My presentation skills, time management, interpersonal, communication, teamwork and entrepreneurship skills are sharpened very much by this course.”

 

But there is only so much the DAREnterprisers course can provide. What Grace and George need is investment, incubation and mentorship. The Tengeneza Tanzania Together is the only way this can happen. But a high quality conference needs funding. This is where you can help us out.

 

What is the Cambridge Development Initiative's DAREnterprisers course?

In a survey done by the non-governmental organization Restless Development, out of over 1,000 young people across Tanzania, only 14 percent reported working a formal, wage-earning job. Youth unemployment is a massive problem for the people of Tanzania - a country with a very low life expectancy of 65 years. We at DAREnterprisers are striving to change things by generating active social enterprises, which solve problems for low income communities through an 8 week course. We also aim to help participants develop transferable skills, build confidence and provide them with a worthwhile experience that sets them up for future career opportunities. We achieve these goals through classroom sessions taught by students from the University of Cambridge and the University of Dar es Salaam, as well as peer-to-peer learning, mentorship and collaboration with local entrepreneurs.

 

Why are we holding a conference?

The Tengeneza Tanzania Together Conference is our participants’ chance to shine: the culmination of eight weeks of work with their business ideas on display. The conference will be attended by incubators, investors and NGOs capable of giving the businesses the mentorship and financial kickstart they need to succeed. Their businesses will be judged by a panel of expert business leaders with feedback to help their businesses have the best start possible. Help us kickstart businesses with the potential to change lives.

 

Great ideas need great people to make them happen. The Tengeneza Tanzania Together Conference is how these great people will connect.

 

Where will your money go?

All donations will go towards the costs of the conference, helping to change the lives of our participants, like George and Grace, and change Tanzania as a whole.

 

 A bit about the Cambridge Development Initiative...

The Cambridge Development Initiative (CDI) is a charity with the aim of empowering local change-makers to make a sustainable difference. They believe that students can be the catalyst. The DAREnterprisers course and conference is only one of the projects under the umbrella of CDI. If you are looking for something amazing to do next Summer, check out the website.
story_txt: Meet GraceIt has often been said that turning copper into gold is impossible. But what about converting human waste into profit? Many of the low-income areas in Dar-es-Salaam have problems disposing properly of their human waste. Grace has a solution. DAREnterprisers has been helping Grace create Rafiki Fertilisers, a social enterprise turning human waste into high-quality fertiliser which can be used to produce higher crop yields, feeding more people in the area. Grace says: “I’ve learned the steps to form social enterprises; right from ideation to prototyping to presentation skills. DAREnterprisers has helped me develop my idea to become physically possible. I also now have a team to work with – a partner who is equally passionate and interested in the idea. We work as a team to make it possible – it’s exciting and fascinating to get that.” Meet GeorgeGeorge is part of City Recycling Agent Centre, a team working on a social enterprise to clean up the streets of Tanzania’s low-income, often unplanned, settlements. The idea is simple: give local people employment by collecting and sorting plastic waste from their peers, and sell it on to larger recycling companies. Imagine Dar-es-Salaam being clean as never before, with no waste and lower crime rates due to higher employment. They will achieve this using innovative technology, alongside personal relationships with the community and local businesses. story:
Hello potential Contributors or Investors, 

The K2thaL Journey

My name is Benjamin Moore III, yes, like the paint company, but no relation. I'd like to thank you for taking time to consider investing in the manifestation of my collective passions, my brainchild, and one of the centerpieces of my life's work - Keyz 2 tha Lexis (K2thaL). Now, I know upon reading that business title it may bring to mind luxury automobiles, but you’d only be half right. Instead, K2thaL is a vehicle to transport learners into the fullest knowledge about how language works, where ‘Lexis’ is Greek meaning word or speech, so Keyz 2 tha Lexis means keys to the word.

K2thaL is an innovative and comprehensive linguistics language arts learning system that uses performing arts, particularly, music, dance, lyricism, and theater as strategies to teach Pre-K through 8th grade students all about the field of Linguistics, which is the science of language. In the K2thaL system, students and instructors sing, dance, rap, and act their way to language proficiency and linguistic mastery. In addition, within K2thaL system, each Linguistic field of study, from phonology to pragmatics, has an array of character instructors, from Master Ninja Lexin to Professor Peabodie Lexla, who are uniquely trained to teach within each field. For over a decade, I have been providing educational facilities, after school programs, and private residences with group learning sessions and private tutoring using the K2thaL method. As an Atlanta native, I have served over 600 students across metro-Atlanta. Many of my K2thaL students have gone on to earn a number of academic accolades such as principal's list, honor roll, nominations and inductions into gifted programs, and literacy awards at proficiency levels that surpass the curricular standards.

I came up with the idea of K2thaL in 2006, began building on that ideation over several years, and then became a Pre-K educator in 2009, affording me the opportunity to implement K2thaL directly in the classroom. In 2012 with the K2thaL system as my motivation, I went on to continue my education a Georgia State University (GSU) by earning a B.A. in Applied Linguistics with minors in English (concentrating my coursework on creative writing) and African American Studies, followed by an M.A. in Applied Linguistics in 2016. I have been a research assistant during undergrad in the Department of English, a graduate research assistant in the College of Education, and am currently a graduate assistant professor in the department of Entrepreneurship and Innovation. In tandem, I am a Ph.D. candidate in the College of Education majoring in Teaching and Learning with a concentration in Language and Literacy. I'm blessed to be on track to be the first person on both sides my family to earn a Ph.D., and with only 1% of the general population earning doctoral degrees, and even more shocking, only 2.5% of all doctoral degrees being earned by black men (according to the national center for education statistics), I feel a great deal of obligation to not only my family, but also to my community, and the world at large. I think it extremely important and necessary for students of color, and in actuality, children of all races, to see black males in a positive light as sources of great wisdom and wielding a wealth of knowledge. Personally, I want to be the dopest, most effective and most fun teacher students will ever encounter, elevating them to the highest heights of their language ability and beyond. Amazingly, Keyz 2 tha Lexis is the platform that affords such an opportunity—to unlock the full potential in every student.

The Campaign: K2thaL Digitized

The specific purpose of this campaign is to raise capital to begin conversion of the K2thaL live sessions that I have been developing over the last decade and produce a series of digital content on a membership-based, e-learning platform. The general aim of digitizing these K2thaL sessions is to create digital content that is effective, awe-inspiring, and fun, through what I call a cinematic learning experience, or an edutainment experience, complete with various degrees of performing arts, animation, visual effects, storylines, segues, interludes, content breakdowns, lesson reviews, interactive activities, gamification, companion lesson guides, and much more.

The funds will be used for two purposes:

1st to build membership-based, e-learning website with integrated apps (android and iOS)

  • Tiered memberships offering various levels of access
  • Direct purchase of lessons with off-line access restricted to the apps

 

2nd to produce three 7-10 minute mini-session videos from the K2thaL system, each accompanied with interactive game activities, which will serve as preliminary content for the website, the springboard for marketing, and the foundation to bootstrap the system or a presentation demo to elicit additional funding. Each mini-session will have a different character instructor from the K2thaL staff teaching the lesson.

The three K2thaL mini-sessions will be as follows.

  • Intro to Linguistics with Captain Lexis (What is Language?)
  • Intro to Scribing with Master Ninja Lexin (Capital A,B and lower case a,b)
  • Intro to Phonics with LexLuthIcon (Short a and long a sounds, i.e. /ă/ and /ā/)

The three K2thaL mini-session activities will be as follows.

  • Passing messages (Student avatar passes messages through various interactions)
  • Scribing letters ninja style (Students have POV experience writing letters like a ninja)
  • A for apple (Student uses rhythm, phonetic notation, and phonics to create an apple tree to a nice beat)

Long term, the website and integrated apps will eventually offer over 90 hours of video lesson content covering the entire spectrum of linguistics studies (graphology, phonology, morphology, semantics, syntax, and pragmatics) with gamification in the form of interactive activities and quizzes as well as other resources and content.

I am projecting that the three mini-sessions will be produced 1st quarter of 2021. During 2nd quarter 2021, the website will soft launch, production will continue, and the demo will be marketed to increase traffic to the website, acquire key endorsers/influencers, and possibly engage investors for a funding round. By 3rd quarter 2021, the website will fully launch and I am hoping to generate enough revenue to sustain or scale production and/or acquire large enough capital investment to maintain or scale production.  

The Ask: K2thaL Funds Breakdown                                        

This K2thaL funding campaign is seeking 65K. The funds will be allocated in the following order, and if the goal isn’t met, the funds will finance each area in order until exhausted.

  • 2.75 K – Covering campaign funding fees
    • Funding platforms charge 5% of total funds. This will cover that charge.
  • 15 K – Hiring professionals to design membership-based e-learning website and integrated apps
    • I will hire a professional to design the website and integrated apps.
  • 5 K – Securing one year of website hosting and storage fees
    • I will ensure the sustainability of the website hosting and storage for at least 12 months.
  • 6 K – Outsourcing a portion of the visual effects and other technical aspects of production
    • Because I am self-taught in the VFX space and still developing my skills, I will hire highly skilled professionals (3-4 VFX artists) to help bring to life my creative vision for the K2thaL video sessions and lessons.
  • 6 K – Hiring gamification designers
    • I will hire skilled professionals (3-4 game designers) to design the interactive activities and quizzes that will accompany the K2thal sessions and lessons.
  • 1.75 K – Funding music licensing
    • I will purchase music licenses for the instrumentals that will be used throughout the video lessons, interactive session activities, and quizzes for the K2thaL system.
  • 2 K – Funding marketing
    • I will focus online marketing write-ups on social media platforms and education-based websites and blogs to drive traffic to the K2thaL website and app. I will approach educational facilities from private childcare to state-funded primary school, school boards, higher-ed early childcare and development departments, etc. with marketing materials from e-flyers to pamphlets about the K2thaL system. Lastly, I will also approach local celebrities, hip-hop and R&B radio stations, social media personalities, and well-known academics to get support as influencers and endorsers.
  • 25 K – Funding full time production, marketing, and seeking investment (Benjamin)
    • I will be involved in every single aspect of the production and business. I will perform as all of the character instructors, operate the camera, do all the vocal work, edit videos, add visual and sound effects, market the products through various channels, and aggressively seek key endorsers, influencers, and possibly additional investors.
  • 1.5 K – Hiring curriculum design consultant
    • I will hire an education professional to assist with curriculum and lesson plan ideation and design.

The Perks: What you get for contributing to K2thaL

I value support and want to reward those who show their belief in K2thaL from day one. The following is the contribution/reward levels.

  • $25 or less
    • One free month of K2thaL online membership
  • $25.01 to $75
    • 3 free months of K2thaL online membership
  • $75.01 to $150
    • 6 free months of K2thaL online membership
    • Production credits on first 3 lessons
  • $150.01 to $250
    • One-year free of K2thaL online membership
    • Production credits on first year of lessons
    • Lifetime “Day One” membership
      • Grandfathered in at $5.37 per month membership price
  • $1000 or more
    • Lifetime free K2thaL membership
    • Lifetime production credits

The Impact: How K2thaL will educate and elevate

K2thaL has the potential to dominate the e-learning space, in general, and the language arts and edutainment space, in particular. The following are aspects and outcomes that make K2thaL so impactful.

  • Solves the issue of e-learning with the current COVID-19 crisis
  • Focuses solely on one of the two most important subjects to later academic and social success- language arts
  • Earliest and most comprehensive language arts-focused program starting at Preschool/PreK and continuing through 8th grade
  • Makes language arts learning fun and exciting through the use of various performing arts
  • Connects students to the content though the unique teaching stylings of each the character instructors from Master Ninja Lexin to CyLeximus
  • Provides greatest opportunity for students to become most proficient in language and literacy
    • Possibility for earlier entry conventional literacy (possibly reading and writing at earlier age)
    • Possibly improve overall analytical skills
    • Possibility to carry over skills to improve success in other subjects
  • Aids teachers and parents in tracking student progress in language arts and literacy development
  • Provides full language arts curriculum and/or supplemental lesson plans for private and public educators and institutions, as well as for home schooling
  • Provides parents with engaging education content that will keep their students’ attention for extended periods and is safe from inappropriate online content
  • Provides convenient learning no matter where students are, whether at home, in a vehicle, or at school because of the web-based platform and integrated mobile apps (android and iOS)
  • Created by an expert with multiple degrees in linguistics and education (a B.A. two minors, an M.A., and is PhD candidate), over a decade of experience in the field of education, and a great wealth of creativity and passion for teaching, learning, language, and performing arts

The mantra for K2thaL is “to achieve the monumentally propitious success of Keyz 2 tha Lexis.” It is the business goal of K2thaL to be the most successful learning program ever to hit the market across several metrics: most improved learners in every age bracket, most proficient learners in every age bracket, greatest household name recognition, most active users/subscribers on any e-learning platform, most paying subscribers on any e-learning platform, most revenues and profits out of any learning program/system

The Challenges: The obstacles that K2thaL will overcome

The major hurtles that K2thaL will face are logistical and financial. The production schedule for the system is a bit aggressive and lengthy. The goal is to produce 3 mini-sessions (30 mins of video content) per week, plus the accompanied interactive activities, games, and other content for a 42-week production year, which produces 21 hours of video content in a calendar year. That is similar to producing a weekly television series with the added responsibility of creating gamification content.

To combat this challenge, I have created a strongly advised weekly/monthly production schedule.

  • ½ day to full day production meeting at the first of the production week
    • Use PowerPoints from live-sessions as storyboards for digital lessons as well as other storyboarding software
  • Audio and video production for 3 mini-sessions produced over 3 days each week (Benjamin)
  • 3-7 days to add VFX to video content each week (Maybe on a weekly schedule that produces output from the previous week’s video production; for example, if content A is produced week 1, then the final VFX output will be rendered week 2)
  • 5-30 days to produce gamification activities and quizzes (Maybe on bi-weekly or monthly schedule that produces output from the previous weeks’ video production; for example, if content A, B, and C are produced weeks 1-3, the final gamification output will be rendered weeks 3-5 or all at once in the month that follows)

The logistics of production from collaboration to cinematography, visual effects to gamification, and editing to uploading will be a challenge. The K2thaL production team will really need to run like a well-oiled machine to crank out the content every week. The full system will encompass approximately 90 video content also with the accompanied interactive activities, games, and other content, which if the 42-week production year is adhered, will take approximately 4 1/3 years to complete the full system.

This is why I am starting funding 6 months before we begin production, so that I can assemble the best team and get us all on the same page in terms of expectations and workflow. In addition, we are doing a soft launch (2nd quarter 2021) 3 months before the full launch (3rd quarter) in an attempt to work out any bugs in the system. I will also seek to attain a strategic partnership with Tyler Perry and Tyler Perry studios, which will serve as the venue and provide the resources necessary for scaling production.

I am aware that this will have to be a goal to be attained at a pace that does not overextend the production crew, under deliver on quality, nor over promise regarding output timelines. If the weekly output goal becomes too great, I am more than willing to scale out the output timeline to make sure that the production quality is A1, top notch. At minimum, the monthly production will be 30 mins of video content with accompanied game activities.

The next challenge is financial. The bulk of the operation costs will be paying the creatives to help produce the system. When approximating a staff of 11 and considering the cost of the e-learning platform, marketing, music licensing, and other operational costs, minimum budget is 800K a year, which equates to 5.13K per 7-10-min mini-session or 15.38K per 30-min full session. Depending on if and how production may be scaled, particularly with regards to bringing on more creatives and professionals, that cost could max out at approximately 2.6 million dollars per year, which equates to 16.67K per 7-10-min mini session or 50K per 30 full session. My hope is that the system can be bootstrapped and enough revenue can be generated to both sustain and scale production.

To combat this challenge, I will rollout an introductory pre-subscription rate of $1.99 per month for the first 6 months of the full launch period ($11.96 total), which will start 3rd and 4th quarter 2021. I will begin presubscriptions as early as 4th quarter 2020 and as late as during soft launch 2nd quarter 2021. The goal would be to acquire 70K subscribers during that 3-9 month period, which would cover minimum budget productions costs for one year ($800K) and the goal is to have that revenue before full launch 3rd quarter 2021. After which, we would be constantly producing more content, acquiring more subscribers, generating more revenues, and thus bootstrapping the system. In the event that we need additional funding, the subscription revenues would serve as our foundation for valuation. I will also seek funding from various grants such as the Small Business Innovation Research grant with the Institute of Education Sciences. In addition, I will also focus on acquiring several key endorsers/influencers in the entertainment industry, particularly, Tyler Perry, Daymond John, T.I. “Tip” Harris, Killer Mike, Ryan Cameron, 2chainz and his wife Kesha Epps, to generate lots publicity and exponentially increase subscriptions.

Alternative ways of supporting the Keyz: How to help outside of crowdfunding

Please share this crowdfunding campaign on all social media platforms and tell all of your friends, teachers, school administrators, principles, daycare owners, and parents about K2thaL! Once the site and apps are launched, please become a paid subscriber!

Lifetime “Day One” membershipGrandfathered in at $5.37 per month membership price




$1000 or more
Lifetime free K2thaL membership
Lifetime production credits


The Impact: How K2thaL will educate and elevateK2thaL has the potential to dominate the e-learning space, in general, and the language arts and edutainment space, in particular. The following are aspects and outcomes that make K2thaL so impactful.
Solves the issue of e-learning with the current COVID-19 crisis
Focuses solely on one of the two most important subjects to later academic and social success- language arts
Earliest and most comprehensive language arts-focused program starting at Preschool/PreK and continuing through 8th grade
Makes language arts learning fun and exciting through the use of various performing arts
Connects students to the content though the unique teaching stylings of each the character instructors from Master Ninja Lexin to CyLeximus
Provides greatest opportunity for students to become most proficient in language and literacy
Possibility for earlier entry conventional literacy (possibly reading and writing at earlier age)
Possibly improve overall analytical skills
Possibility to carry over skills to improve success in other subjects


Aids teachers and parents in tracking student progress in language arts and literacy development
Provides full language arts curriculum and/or supplemental lesson plans for private and public educators and institutions, as well as for home schooling
Provides parents with engaging education content that will keep their students’ attention for extended periods and is safe from inappropriate online content
Provides convenient learning no matter where students are, whether at home, in a vehicle, or at school because of the web-based platform and integrated mobile apps (android and iOS)
Created by an expert with multiple degrees in linguistics and education (a B.A. two minors, an M.A., and is PhD candidate), over a decade of experience in the field of education, and a great wealth of creativity and passion for teaching, learning, language, and performing arts
The mantra for K2thaL is “to achieve the monumentally propitious success of Keyz 2 tha Lexis.” It is the business goal of K2thaL to be the most successful learning program ever to hit the market across several metrics: most improved learners in every age bracket, most proficient learners in every age bracket, greatest household name recognition, most active users/subscribers on any e-learning platform, most paying subscribers on any e-learning platform, most revenues and profits out of any learning program/systemThe Challenges: The obstacles that K2thaL will overcome The major hurtles that K2thaL will face are logistical and financial. The production schedule for the system is a bit aggressive and lengthy. The goal is to produce 3 mini-sessions (30 mins of video content) per week, plus the accompanied interactive activities, games, and other content for a 42-week production year, which produces 21 hours of video content in a calendar year. That is similar to producing a weekly television series with the added responsibility of creating gamification content.To combat this challenge, I have created a strongly advised weekly/monthly production schedule.
½ day to full day production meeting at the first of the production weekUse PowerPoints from live-sessions as storyboards for digital lessons as well as other storyboarding software

Audio and video production for 3 mini-sessions produced over 3 days each week (Benjamin)
3-7 days to add VFX to video content each week (Maybe on a weekly schedule that produces output from the previous week’s video production; for example, if content A is produced week 1, then the final VFX output will be rendered week 2)
5-30 days to produce gamification activities and quizzes (Maybe on bi-weekly or monthly schedule that produces output from the previous weeks’ video production; for example, if content A, B, and C are produced weeks 1-3, the final gamification output will be rendered weeks 3-5 or all at once in the month that follows)
The logistics of production from collaboration to cinematography, visual effects to gamification, and editing to uploading will be a challenge. The K2thaL production team will really need to run like a well-oiled machine to crank out the content every week. The full system will encompass approximately 90 video content also with the accompanied interactive activities, games, and other content, which if the 42-week production year is adhered, will take approximately 4 1/3 years to complete the full system.This is why I am starting funding 6 months before we begin production, so that I can assemble the best team and get us all on the same page in terms of expectations and workflow. In addition, we are doing a soft launch (2nd quarter 2021) 3 months before the full launch (3rd quarter) in an attempt to work out any bugs in the system. I will also seek to attain a strategic partnership with Tyler Perry and Tyler Perry studios, which will serve as the venue and provide the resources necessary for scaling production.
I am aware that this will have to be a goal to be attained at a pace that does not overextend the production crew, under deliver on quality, nor over promise regarding output timelines. If the weekly output goal becomes too great, I am more than willing to scale out the output timeline to make sure that the production quality is A1, top notch. At minimum, the monthly production will be 30 mins of video content with accompanied game activities.
The next challenge is financial. The bulk of the operation costs will be paying the creatives to help produce the system. When approximating a staff of 11 and considering the cost of the e-learning platform, marketing, music licensing, and other operational costs, minimum budget is 800K a year, which equates to 5.13K per 7-10-min mini-session or 15.38K per 30-min full session. Depending on if and how production may be scaled, particularly with regards to bringing on more creatives and professionals, that cost could max out at approximately 2.6 million dollars per year, which equates to 16.67K per 7-10-min mini session or 50K per 30 full session. My hope is that the system can be bootstrapped and enough revenue can be generated to both sustain and scale production.
To combat this challenge, I will rollout an introductory pre-subscription rate of $1.99 per month for the first 6 months of the full launch period ($11.96 total), which will start 3rd and 4th quarter 2021. I will begin presubscriptions as early as 4th quarter 2020 and as late as during soft launch 2nd quarter 2021. The goal would be to acquire 70K subscribers during that 3-9 month period, which would cover minimum budget productions costs for one year ($800K) and the goal is to have that revenue before full launch 3rd quarter 2021. After which, we would be constantly producing more content, acquiring more subscribers, generating more revenues, and thus bootstrapping the system. In the event that we need additional funding, the subscription revenues would serve as our foundation for valuation. I will also seek funding from various grants such as the Small Business Innovation Research grant with the Institute of Education Sciences. In addition, I will also focus on acquiring several key endorsers/influencers in the entertainment industry, particularly, Tyler Perry, Daymond John, T.I. “Tip” Harris, Killer Mike, Ryan Cameron, 2chainz and his wife Kesha Epps, to generate lots publicity and exponentially increase subscriptions.Alternative ways of supporting the Keyz: How to help outside of crowdfunding Please share this crowdfunding campaign on all social media platforms and tell all of your friends, teachers, school administrators, principles, daycare owners, and parents about K2thaL! Once the site and apps are launched, please become a paid subscriber!

story:
¿Cuál es nuestra historia?

Hace unos años, Sergio Hernández, nuestro profesor en la universidad, decidió salir al parque, cerca de su casa, para jugar con sus hijos e inventar cosas usando cartón. En el 2015, apoyado por una fundación promotora del juego creativo, Sergio invitó a sus vecinos a participar en las actividades. La idea: crear comunidad jugando. Cada sábado un montón de niñas y niños se reunían a inventar, imaginar y compartir sus creaciones.

Platicando con varios expertos de emprendimiento y desarrollo social de nuestra universidad (Alejandro Morales, Doria Torres y Violeta Sandoval) surgió la inquietud de llevar el juego creativo a otros espacios para fortalecer el tejido social. Es así como el proyecto se traslada, de la mano de cuatro estudiantes de ingeniería y arte, a una nueva comunidad.

Así comienza Estación Meiquer con trazos de imaginación, ideas de plastilina y cartones llenos de sueños.

 

Un año después Estación Meiquer sigue creciendo y sumando más colaboradores. Queremos que el juego y la imaginación lleguen a más lugares.

 

¿Cuál es nuestra pasión?

Nuestra pasión es transformar nuestra comunidad a través del juego. Buscamos desarrollar habilidades en los niños y niñas: pensamiento crítico, solución de problemas, creatividad, inteligencia emocional y trabajo en equipo. Creemos firmemente que estas habilidades son indispensables para lograr el cambio.

 

¿Quiénes están en el equipo?

Estación Meiquer somos: 

  • Sergio Hernández, profesor universitario, le gusta mucho jugar con sus hijos.
  • Sebastián de la Hoz, estudiante de ingeniería.
  • César Espinosa, estudiante de ingeniería.
  • Miguel Pérez, estudiante de ingeniería.
  • Iván Plascencia, estudiante de ingeniería.
  • Miguel Cabral, estudiante de ingeniería,

... y los que vengan...

Estación Meiquer tiene un significado especial para todos nosotros porque queremos que el juego sea parte de la educación. Jugar es inspirar,imaginar, construir, experimentar, compartir y crear comunidad. ¿Recuerdas todas las sonrisas que tuviste cuando jugabas?

 

¿Qué necesitamos?

Hemos realizado 44 talleres pero queremos crecer y llegar a más comunidades. Con tu ayuda, podemos conseguir que cada vez más niños y niñas participen en Estación Meiquer.

Para esta campaña, nuestra meta es conseguir los recursos para comprar el material básico para una estación de juego creativo.

Una estación de juego creativo está conformada de herramientas tecnológicas y materiales para que los niños experimenten con sus ideas. 

Si superamos la meta, se invertirá el dinero para comprar el material necesario para un laboratorio más avanzado.

De no conseguir los fondos necesarios, se revisará qué materiales pueden ser comprados y usaremos esos para impartir nuestros cursos de verano, así como replicar el mismo curso en comunidades en situación vulnerable. 

 
 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Si te interesa nuestro proyecto pero no puedes apoyar económicamente, ¡no te preocupes! También puedes: 

  • Contarle de nuestro proyecto a alguien más
  • Seguirnos en Facebook y compartir el proyecto con tus amigos.

¡Muchas gracias por tu apoyo! Y recuerda, ante todo, sonríe :)

story:
I am JuJu Blue, and I am an Artivist: Art(ist) + (Act)ivist and I am a Breast Cancer Survivor/Thriver. The psychological impact of breast cancer can be devastating. Factor in the physical loss of a breast from cancer and the psychological loss for a woman who is unmarried or whose hopes for having a mate seem somewhat dashed and the impact can be severely devastating. But, painting pictures with my breasts coupled with my inspirational messages uplift those in the storm of breast cancer and help them and their caregivers understand that they are needed, they are beautiful, they are resilient and not alone.

 

Diagnosed with breast cancer at 47 in 2007, I found painting with my breast a wonderful mode of art therapy which helped me heal from some deeper issues associated with the ravages of breast cancer which I could otherwise perhaps not express in words. The way it affected my mind (from chemo-brain for one thing), body (from the surgery and radiation) and psyche (in terms of wondering whether I would survive while others around me did not), I found that painting with my breasts enabled me to delve deeper and create some sunshine on a rainy day for me. You see, I found a way to flourish despite the tempest. Initially, it was a way to express myself without words. Before the paint could dry, I knew that I had to share my art work and couple it with some inspirational words to help others because by concentrating your energies on others, you lessen your own burden. 


Having breast cancer was actually a gift, which enabled me to turn something so ugly into something beautiful. I'm told that my breast art paintings and my words inspire and uplift those with breast cancer and they have enabled me to be a brighter beacon to those in the storm.  Perhaps those stricken with breast cancer will be compelled to do the same - - - reach out and touch someone else who has been touched by cancer and uplift them - - - and create a domino effect.

 

My audience is women diagnosed with breast cancer and their caregivers. I understand them because I AM them. By turning my art into cancer support cards and calendars coupled with uplifting messages and mailing them out to women stricken with breast cancer, I empower them from the stance of someone in the same bra as they are (i.e., someone who is in the struggle and at times, I sell some everyday items (e.g., watches, purses, envelope openers, keychains, umbrellas) to which I have applied my artwork in order to offset the cost of printing and mailing  the free postcards and calendars with uplifting messages to breast cancer patients.

 

What is art, if not the expression of creative skill and imagination which produces works to be appreciated for their beauty or emotional power? My art in which I use my breasts as paintbrushes does the same and knowing that I, too am a survivor and that I paint pictures with my breasts makes cancer survivors want to read the inspirational messages and realize that they can do wonderful things despite and while surviving breast cancer. I remind them that just as the tireless hummingbird, they are capable of traveling astonishing distances on their own wings and to keep seeking the sweetest nectar and the beauty in each day.

 

If my campaign doesn't happen, I will still paint and print my artwork and turn it into inspirational postcards and calendars and mail them out to women fighting breast cancer plus continue to donate some of the everyday items I've made from my artwork to organizations (e.g., www.PaBreastCancer.org) so they can put it in the care packages they send to women who are newly diagnosed with breast cancer - - - I just may not reach as many in time to make as much of an impact on their lives if the campaign doesn't happen.

 

Sometimes the cure is worse than the disease. I had a mastectomy in May 2011 because of the radiation I received in 2007. The ways of battle are second nature to me and I will never stop fighting. And along the way, I will keep seeking the sweetest nectar and the beauty in each day so that I can share it with someone else.

 

In closing, I will share this motivational message I strive to live by: "Work for a cause, not for applause. Live life to express, not to impress. Don't strive to make your presence noticed, just make your absence felt."

story:
Short Summary

"I am a human being and Dharma leads us to do good to fellow human beings.  That is everybody's responsibility without any borders or limits.  No social status, no caste, no skin color or race.  It is a universal responsibility to move compassion into action.  It is for that reason."  - Lama Tenzin Choegyal

In 2001,  Lama Tenzin, a young Tibetan monk, began his journey to rescue children from poor living conditions in the isolated villages in the Himalayan border region of Upper Dolpo, Nepal. He built a home for them in India where he, his mother and his sisters raised and educated them, and provided them with spiritual guidance with the hope that these children would return to their homes one day and do the same for their communities. The journey to rescue these children is very dangerous. The Dolpo is the highest inhabited region on the planet, with villages around 15,000-17,000 feet in elevation.There is little in Dolpo in the way of food, employment, medicine or schooling. The central government is far away in Kathmandu, and little assistance has been given to the residents of Dolpo in the form of bridges, roads, clinics, or basic infrastructure. In fact, there are no roads anywhere in Dolpo. All transportation is on foot or by horseback. Yaks are often used as beasts of burden.

Children in Dolpo start work as early as the age of four, gathering twigs and yak dung for fuel, or minding the yaks. Living with their animals, the children often contract diseases such as skin anthrax. Food is comprised of barley meal, yak milk, yak cheese and Tibetan tea.

Over the past 10 years, CED HOUSE  has grown to 21 orphans and underprivileged children. The children are mostly girls, some of whom have disabilities. The first group of these children will be graduating from high school this year-marking the first time children from these remote border villages have ever received a formal education. The culture in these remote regions still favors sons over daughters. The traditions still support old ideas that keep alive the inequalities between men and women by maintaining that only boys can provide financial support for the family. And girls born with disabilites are quite literally discarded by their families and the larger village community, believed to be "bad omens". Lama Tenzin first saw Pema-the young girl  whose rescue is depicted in the attached video - who was born unable to walk - living outside with the cows and other animals, given a bowl of food and nothing else each day. She was quite literally left outside with the animals until Lama Tenzin obtained permission from her family and the Nepali Government to take her in and give her a chance at a full life.

I have known Lama Tenzin for many years. I call him The Feminist Lama- because he believes and dedicates his life to ensuring that women's voices and ideas are as valuable as those of men. He knows that education increases girls’ options to live a full and meaningful life empowering them to take leadership roles in family, school, and community. Your support will allow Lama Tenzin to continue this vital work of the rescue, nurture and education of these girls that have no other advocate. They are truly forgotten. You have the rare opportunity with your donations to deliver a meaningful life to a child who may become the next great doctor, inventor, lawyer, scientist, writer or teacher. If we support them - they will take their knowledge into the world and some will even return to their villages and enrich their communities in ways we cannot imagine. They also recieve practical vocational skill training so that they may seek meaningful employment and acheive economic independence.

Together, with Lama Tenzin Choegyal you can remove the educational, societal, and professional barriers for girls with disabilities.

 Please give what you can. Our $40,000 goal will go toward the immediate rescue trek to Upper Dolpo that is planned for this June! Without these vital funds, Lama Tenzin cannot rescue another child like Pema, who is now thriving in her new home at Lama's orphanage in Dehardun, India. She is going to school, receiving medical care and the nutrition she needs to grow into a healthy and independent young woman.

If you are unable to contribute yourself, please share this with others, send people to the website http://cedhouse-org.readysitebuild.com/gift-pro... and facebook page https://www.facebook.com/pages/Lama-Tenzin-CIA-... so that others may learn about this extraordinary Monk and the mission he and he alone is leading.
 
Thank you so much for your consideration.

story:
Short Summary

Columbine Elementary PTA has been raising money for 4+ years for a Growing Dome Greenhouse to compliment our Garden to Table Program and serve as a year round growing and learning center for classes.  We are now only ~$4,000 shy of our goal and hope you can help!  (Since we started this Indiegogo campaign, we have received a donation of $1,500 in addition to the contributions shown above!)

The mission of this project is to encourage children to seek, grow, prepare and eat nourishing, delicious and sustainably grown food, empower them to make choices that have a positive influence on their personal health, family, community and surrounding environment, and create a more vibrant, hands-on learning environment. 

A Growing Dome would enable students to grow their own food supplementing their salad bar throughout the school year, sprout seedlings for spring in-ground planting, and provide an excellent hands-on learning center for science, math, and language arts. 

Columbine Elementary is a neighborhood public school located in “Old North Boulder”. With over 70% Latino and low-income students, statistics place many of Columbine Elementary’s students at greater risk of developing diabetes and other negative health conditions that can often be prevented through adopting routines of healthy food choices and exercise. 

We are working with Growing Gardens ed program to create grade-specific programs in our greenhouse to help meet learning benchmarks.  Our hope is that through a fun, hands-on Garden & Greenhouse to Table Program, students will learn to grow, prepare, and enjoy healthy foods and the wellness, satisfaction and other benefits that gardening and healthy eating can bring. 

Additionally, studies show that healthy foods and proper exercise benefit students by better preparing them for learning and concentration, increasing academic performance.  Our school is already part of BVSD’s Healthy School Lunch Program, and we believe that a Growing Dome will be an excellent addition to this program, greatly benefiting our students’ health and learning potential.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

Since we started this Indiegogo campaign, we have received a direct donation of $1,500 - the amount needed to purchase the greenhouse!!!  This raises our total fundraising to over $23,000 in direct and in-kind donations.  Now we only need ~$4,000 more to reach our financial goal for supplies and maintenance of our Growing Dome Greenhouse!  

Donors at the $25 and higher level will receive recognition with gold, silver and bronze leaves engraved with their names inside the greenhouse and will be thanked publicly in our press releases and online.  (You are also welcome to donate anonymously - just let us know if that's your preference.)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word to your friends and colleagues and let us know if you would like to donate your time or other resources to the buildout and maintenance of our greenhouse.  Thank you!!!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Columbine Elementary PTA has been raising money for 4+ years for a Growing Dome Greenhouse to compliment our Garden to Table Program and serve as a year round growing and learning center for classes.  We are now only ~$4,000 shy of our goal and hope you can help!  (Since we started this Indiegogo campaign, we have received a donation of $1,500 in addition to the contributions shown above!)
The mission of this project is to encourage children to seek, grow, prepare and eat nourishing, delicious and sustainably grown food, empower them to make choices that have a positive influence on their personal health, family, community and surrounding environment, and create a more vibrant, hands-on learning environment. 
A Growing Dome would enable students to grow their own food supplementing their salad bar throughout the school year, sprout seedlings for spring in-ground planting, and provide an excellent hands-on learning center for science, math, and language arts. 
Columbine Elementary is a neighborhood public school located in “Old North Boulder”. What We Need & What You Get
Since we started this Indiegogo campaign, we have received a direct donation of $1,500 - the amount needed to purchase the greenhouse!!!  This raises our total fundraising to over $23,000 in direct and in-kind donations.  Now we only need ~$4,000 more to reach our financial goal for supplies and maintenance of our Growing Dome Greenhouse!  
Donors at the $25 and higher level will receive recognition with gold, silver and bronze leaves engraved with their names inside the greenhouse and will be thanked publicly in our press releases and online.  (You are also welcome to donate anonymously - just let us know if that's your preference.)
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Please help us spread the word to your friends and colleagues and let us know if you would like to donate your time or other resources to the buildout and maintenance of our greenhouse.  Thank you!!!

story:
Azziza Who?? 

Hey there team! Azziza here. I'm a single mom with 2 amazing daughters; ages 8 and 3. I am determined to set the very best example for them and earn my nursing degree. But I need your help to get there! If this reaches 1,000 people & each donates $3-$4 it CAN & WILL be done before class starts this semester! :) 

***  HINT: Skip to the "PAY IT FORWARD" bullet point for the really good stuff. ***

The Break Down

Due to financial aid requirement changes since I was last enrolled in college over 3 years ago, I must successfully complete 21 credits without financial aid before enrolling in a nursing program using full aid, scholarships, and grants. I am currently ENROLLED in the courses below. I will take the additional 6 credits next semester (only 2, 3 credit courses remain for the certificate to transfer.) 

Here it is:

  • Abnormal Psychology - 3.0 credits - $437.20
  • College Technical Math 1A - 3.0 credits - $407.20
  • Contemporary American Society - 3.0 credits - $437.20
  • General Biology - 4.0 credits - $563.60
  • Technical Writing - 3.0 credits - $407.20
  • Books & Required Class Materials Total: $700.00

Total Tuition for 16 credits: $2,252.40  ...with books & materials: $2,952.40

Paying It Forward & The Grand Plan

If you're still reading, you probably think that I REALLY need to take that math class! Well, the additional $547.60 included in my goal will help fund...

  • Refresher course & renewal of my CNA (Certified Nursing Assistant) license

So I can....

  • Finacially support my family while I am in school AND
  • PAY IT FORWARD by donating $100 per month (in $25 weekly incriments) to other causes listed right here on indiegogo until the final campaign amount has been "repaid"! The more money I raise, the more comes back to fund other awesome causes.
  • August 7 Update: I'll start a blog to track thee repayment of donations & post the link here as soon as it's up & running. 

But What If...

I don't reach my goal?

  • The first monies raised will go towards my CNA license renewal. Supporting myself & my family is top priority! 
    • Have the financial means to save for my continuing education.
  • After that, I will start with the least expensive courses first to maximize the credits I complete this semester.

Let's Get It Started!

story:
English version below

 

¿Qué es y cómo surge math2me.com?

En Marzo de 2009 Alejandro Andalón y Maria González fundaron el sitio math2me.com (antes asesoriasdematematicas.com) donde los estudiantes pueden accesar a materiales gratuitos en video en el área de matemáticas de nivel secundaria, preparatoria y sistema abierto (educación para adultos) acorde a los planes de estudio en México, esperamos en un futuro contar con la currícula de estudio de cada país. O acceder directamente al tema que les interese Algebra, Geometría Analítica, Trigonometría, Aritmética, Geometría Euclidiana, Estadística, Probabilidad, Calculo Diferencial, Análisis de Funciones, Series y Sucesiones, Olimpiadas y Guías de Estudio.

Actualmente la página contiene +970 videos de diversos temas de matemáticas en formato HD con la posibilidad de descargarlos gratuitamente para su estudio, distribuirlos por redes sociales, descargar la aplicación gratuita para Ipod touch y Iphone. Hasta Abril de 2011 tenemos +3,400,000 vistas a los videos y actualmente trabajamos en la traducción al idioma inglés y sección de ejercicios en línea. Todos los servicios de la página son gratuitos.

En math2me.com el alumno puede buscar información sobre un tema visto en clase que le interese repasar, puede adelantarse en sus materias preparándose con anticipación, puede nivelarse si tiene problemas en un tema o materia, con la ventaja de revisar en material las veces que sea necesario, sin importar horario o día de la semana o del año. Una persona adulta de igual forma puede entrar para recordar un tema, para repasar información, para prepararse en general o incluso regresar a o terminar algún curso.

 

Impacto social

Alrededor de 25,000 reproducciones diarias recibimos en math2me.com, nuestra intención es atender el doble de estudiantes y resolver sus dudas. Sin embargo, aun tenemos varios temas sin terminar y cuando se trabaja  con equipo o en condiciones no adecuadas se hace mas difícil la sustentabilidad de math2me.com.

 

Es por eso que insistimos en pedir su apoyo a nuestra causa que es la causa de muchos alumnos que diariamente se comunican con nosotros para decirnos en todo lo que se les ha ayudado como pasar exámenes, exámenes finales, exámenes de admisión o salvar la materia, así como maestros que les ha servido este material para mostrarles a sus alumnos formas alternativas de estudio o como complemento a la clase.

 

Sin tu ayuda, no podremos ayudar a tantos estudiantes que lo que necesitan es una herramienta de estudio para salir adelante, no tendremos la capacidad de brindar un servicio de ejercicios para que los alumnos puedan autoevaluarse y poner a su disposición aplicaciones de dispositivos móviles para que vean los videos sin necesidad de una computadora.

 

¿Por qué necesitamos tu apoyo?

 

Para poder comprar y/cubrir los gastos:

- Cámara de video semi-profesional HD. Nos interesa tener una cámara en la que no utilicemos cassets ya que gastamos mucho mas dinero en eso, el tiempo que se utiliza pasando el video del casset a la computadora es demasiado y mejorar la calidad de la imagen.

 - Luces. Para tener una buena calidad en la imagen de los videos ya que se tiene que trabajar con un solo foco que no ayuda para nada, además del tiempo que toma acomodar este foco y que no sobreexponga el video.

- Micrófono de alta calidad en la que no se escuche todo lo que pase alrededor, sino las clases.

- Se necesita atender situaciones legales de math2me.com como convertirnos en una Asociación Civil.

- Crear las aplicaciones para iphone, ipod, blackberry, ipad, android.

- Desarrollar la sección de ejercicios para que además de aprender con los videos los usuarios tengan la posibilidad de practicar lo que ven. 

- Se necesitan 2 laptops para editar videos, subirlos a Internet, trabajar en el diseño, realizar programación y demás.

- Disco duro de 4 TB.

 

¡Te necesitamos!

Por favor ayúdanos con tu donativo para cumplir con nuestra meta y seguir realizando esta labor de una mejor y mas eficiente manera. Recuerda distribuir este video con al menos 5 personas. Entre todos podemos lograrlo.

 

En otras ocasiones hemos solicitado prestamos al gobierno o bancos para continuar con la pagina de Internet, pero lo único que ha pasado es que nos hemos llenado de deudas y ahora la única solución es contar con su aportación.

 

GRACIAS.

 

Sigue nuestro progreso en las diferentes redes sociales, como:

www.twitter.com/math2me    

www.facebook.com/math2me.fan

www.youtube.com/asesoriasdematecom

 

O visita la pagina:

www.math2me.com 

 

(Antes asesoriasdematematicas.com)

 

English version

What is math2me.com? 

On March 2009 Alejandro Andalón and Maria González founded the website asesoriasdematematicas.com (now becaming math2me.com since April 2011) where students can access to free math videos in Spanish from different subjects of grades 7 to grade 12 and continuing education for adults: Algebra, Analytic Geometry, Trigonometry, Arithmetic, Euclidean Geometry, Statistics, Probability, Differential calculus, Analysis of Functions, Math Olympiad and Study Guides for tests. 

Currently math2me contains more than +970 math videos and some of them in HD format with the option of free download for study them and free application for iPod touch and iPhone. 

We have +3,700,000 views in our youtube videos and we expected increase this number with the translation in English language and the exercise section online. All our services we want to keep them for free.

Social impact 

Math2me.com receives around 25,000 daily views (until April 2011), but we want to double this number and still help them answer their doubts via Facebook or math2me.com. However, we still have several delay issues a consequence of our current conditions that it makes more difficult to continue working in math2me.
 
Without your help and support, we won’t be able to help the amount of students that need this website as a tool of study, create more applications for mobile devices and create the practice section soon.

 Why we need your support? 
  
To purchase and / pay:
-  Semi-pro camcorder. Currently we used miniDV format that we spend a lot time and money than HD digital format.  

- Light set. We have been using commercial bulbs and manual adaptations that they do not allow us work properly with the image video. 

- High quality microphone. To reduce the noise that it is around, and be more focus in the lesson instead of the noise.

-  Paper work. Formal situation of math2me.com as non-profit organization.

- Develop applications. Blackberry, Ipad and Android. 

- Develop practice section. Allow to students practice and learn online.

- Upgrade our computers. We want to buy 2 new laptops to work faster in the edition and design.

- Hard Drive 4 TB. Storage purpose.
  
We need you! 

Please help us with your donation to reach our goal and continue to make this work better and more efficient. 

Remember distribute this video with at least 5 friends. Together we can do it. 

P.S. Previously we have asked for government funds and bank loans to financially support this website, but at the end we have to pay them.

THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT.

Follow us:

http://www.facebook.com/math2me.fan  
http://www.youtube.com/asesoriasdematecom   
http://www.twitter.com/math2me  


Or visit the website (spanish): 
www.math2me.com

story:
Short Summary

Sarus Exchange Program promotes peace and understanding between Cambodia and Vietnam by offering youth leaders from the two countries a deeply collaborative, personally transformative exchange. Sarus brings together twenty university students annually, ten from each country, for a month of physically and mentally demanding service and study. In regular group meetings students reflect, share insights and handle conflict productively. Our goal is to build connections for cross-border cooperation between future leaders in the two countries.

Beginning in March and running through August, Sarus Exchange has three components: orientation and training, the exchange program, and individual community education projects. During orientation and training each country group of ten students prepares for the July exchange through work with personal research mentors and by attending a series of seminars, field trips and service opportunities with a local orphanage. During the July exchange students live together for two weeks in each country, construct rural development projects, continue to mentor disadvantaged children, and embark on cultural research excursions. Returning from the intensive exchange, students come home to complete community education projects. In August, they present their research, learning, service and exchange experiences in their home communities, extending their learning to peers, friends, family and the greater public. Young women and men ages eighteen to twenty-two participate equally in Sarus, and all are student leaders at their respective universities in Cambodia and Vietnam.

If you would like to know more about the program before you donate, please visit our website. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to run the 2012 program, we need to raise $10,000 by June 1.

The money you donate will go toward supporting the costs of participants' travel, accommodations, and food during the program. It will also partially cover the costs of construction projects that our students complete for our project partners in both countries. Last year, our students built hygenic latrines for an orphanage in Kampong Speu and a concrete floodwall for a school in Ho Chi Minh City for children whose parents can't afford schools fees.

Sarus operates on break-even budget, and we do not waste a single penny. The program director receives no compensation for his work. The staff earn a modest stipend, which accounts for less than ten percent of programs costs. All staff have other full time jobs to support themselves. For all of us at Sarus, we do this work because we can see the incredible impact it has on our students, and we believe in the value of promoting peace between Cambodia and Vietnam. As a contributor to Sarus, you can be confident that your money is being used frugally and wisely. We will be happy to provide more financial details about Sarus upon request.

The Impact

Sarus Exchange successfully addresses a largely unmet, singular need: peace and mutual understanding between Cambodians and Vietnamese.  Fighting between the two countries has been taking place for centuries with open war as recently the 1980s. There is real possibility of renewed, open conflict in the event of an economic crisis or a shift in the delicate political balance between the countries. As waves of open-minded alumni become young leaders, they can draw on these experiences to positively influence policies and public opinion of the other country.

Sarus’ 2011 inaugural year exceeded expectations. Among the first group of Sarus exchange students, over eighty percent had never before left their home country. On the personal and group levels students became more confident and open to communicating and working in teams towards their community service goals. Students constructed two latrines at a rural Cambodian orphanage and a floodwall for an underserved urban school in Vietnam. Each Sarus participant spent over one hundred hours mentoring children in both countries. En route to forging deep, cross-cultural bonds, students completed independent research projects focused on each other’s countries. Topics were as varied and vibrant as student personalities, ranging from a comparative study of social media use in the two countries, to an analysis of the impact the garment industry has had on traditional clothing.

One month after the program’s end, completely independent from any Sarus support, sixteen of twenty-one Sarus Alumni reunited at their first joint service site, the OCTO orphanage in Cambodia. This student-initiated service trip speaks to the lasting bonds formed during the exchange program, the budding leadership and cooperation among students, and their enduring commitment to community development. 

We have substantial momentum moving forward into the 2012 exchange. All original staff remain, and we have hired three alumni as program assistants, a testament to both Sarus’ dedication to our students, and their enthusiasm for the Sarus Exchange Program. Our staff is a driven team of young Cambodians and Vietnamese, efficient because of their strong leadership skills and first-hand knowledge of the Sarus model. Staff are compensated for their efforts, but at a wage far below the standard for qualified graduates, leaving the majority of their efforts as in-kind donations.

The 2012 applicant pool was larger and more competitive, signaling growth and a trajectory towards even greater results in coming years. It is important that our programming both support and enhance our students’ primary educational pursuits. To this end, Sarus has already begun implementation of a Research Advisor program, pairing individual students with native English speakers qualified to help guide and assess student learning. A curriculum review of Sarus is also underway, with the end goal of further tailoring an already successful research course to meet the specific needs of Sarus students. This focus on increased academic rigor and support will assure that students are pushed and motivated to conduct high quality independent research.

In short, we are a group of young people who have committed our time and resources to  promoting peace between Cambodia and Vietnam. We have a proven concept and are in the process of improving it.  All we need to keep this program going is your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would appreciate any help you can give. Even if you are not in a financial position to donate, please spread the word to your friends and family and through social netoworking websites like facebook. Also, please use our IndieGoGo share tools- they are a great way to attract more people to our campaign page.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Sarus Exchange Program promotes peace and understanding between Cambodia and Vietnam by offering youth leaders from the two countries a deeply collaborative, personally transformative exchange. Sarus brings together twenty university students annually, ten from each country, for a month of physically and mentally demanding service and study. In regular group meetings students reflect, share insights and handle conflict productively. Our goal is to build connections for cross-border cooperation between future leaders in the two countries.
Beginning in March and running through August, Sarus Exchange has three components: orientation and training, the exchange program, and individual community education projects. During orientation and training each country group of ten students prepares for the July exchange through work with personal research mentors and by attending a series of seminars, field trips and service opportunities with a local orphanage. During the July exchange students live together for two weeks in each country, construct rural development projects, continue to mentor disadvantaged children, and embark on cultural research excursions. Returning from the intensive exchange, students come home to complete community education projects. In August, they present their research, learning, service and exchange experiences in their home communities, extending their learning to peers, friends, family and the greater public. Young women and men ages eighteen to twenty-two participate equally in Sarus, and all are student leaders at their respective universities in Cambodia and Vietnam.
If you would like to know more about the program before you donate, please visit our website. 
What We Need & What You Get
In order to run the 2012 program, we need to raise $10,000 by June 1.
The money you donate will go toward supporting the costs of participants' travel, accommodations, and food during the program. It will also partially cover the costs of construction projects that our students complete for our project partners in both countries. Last year, our students built hygenic latrines for an orphanage in Kampong Speu and a concrete floodwall for a school in Ho Chi Minh City for children whose parents can't afford schools fees.
Sarus operates on break-even budget, and we do not waste a single penny. The program director receives no compensation for his work. The staff earn a modest stipend, which accounts for less than ten percent of programs costs. All staff have other full time jobs to support themselves. For all of us at Sarus, we do this work because we can see the incredible impact it has on our students, and we believe in the value of promoting peace between Cambodia and Vietnam. As a contributor to Sarus, you can be confident that your money is being used frugally and wisely. We will be happy to provide more financial details about Sarus upon request.
The Impact
Sarus Exchange successfully addresses a largely unmet, singular need: peace and mutual understanding between Cambodians and Vietnamese.  Fighting between the two countries has been taking place for centuries with open war as recently the 1980s. There is real possibility of renewed, open conflict in the event of an economic crisis or a shift in the delicate political balance between the countries. As waves of open-minded alumni become young leaders, they can draw on these experiences to positively influence policies and public opinion of the other country.
Sarus’ 2011 inaugural year exceeded expectations. Among the first group of Sarus exchange students, over eighty percent had never before left their home country. On the personal and group levels students became more confident and open to communicating and working in teams towards their community service goals. Students constructed two latrines at a rural Cambodian orphanage and a floodwall for an underserved urban school in Vietnam. Each Sarus participant spent over one hundred hours mentoring children in both countries. En route to forging deep, cross-cultural bonds, students completed independent research projects focused on each other’s countries. Topics were as varied and vibrant as student personalities, ranging from a comparative study of social media use in the two countries, to an analysis of the impact the garment industry has had on traditional clothing.
One month after the program’s end, completely independent from any Sarus support, sixteen of twenty-one Sarus Alumni reunited at their first joint service site, the OCTO orphanage in Cambodia. This student-initiated service trip speaks to the lasting bonds formed during the exchange program, the budding leadership and cooperation among students, and their enduring commitment to community development. 
We have substantial momentum moving forward into the 2012 exchange. All original staff remain, and we have hired three alumni as program assistants, a testament to both Sarus’ dedication to our students, and their enthusiasm for the Sarus Exchange Program. Our staff is a driven team of young Cambodians and Vietnamese, efficient because of their strong leadership skills and first-hand knowledge of the Sarus model. Staff are compensated for their efforts, but at a wage far below the standard for qualified graduates, leaving the majority of their efforts as in-kind donations.
The 2012 applicant pool was larger and more competitive, signaling growth and a trajectory towards even greater results in coming years. It is important that our programming both support and enhance our students’ primary educational pursuits. To this end, Sarus has already begun implementation of a Research Advisor program, pairing individual students with native English speakers qualified to help guide and assess student learning. A curriculum review of Sarus is also underway, with the end goal of further tailoring an already successful research course to meet the specific needs of Sarus students. This focus on increased academic rigor and support will assure that students are pushed and motivated to conduct high quality independent research.
In short, we are a group of young people who have committed our time and resources to  promoting peace between Cambodia and Vietnam. We have a proven concept and are in the process of improving it.  All we need to keep this program going is your support.
Other Ways You Can Help
We would appreciate any help you can give. Even if you are not in a financial position to donate, please spread the word to your friends and family and through social netoworking websites like facebook. Also, please use our IndieGoGo share tools- they are a great way to attract more people to our campaign page.

story:
check this out - http://www.rock-art-in-wales.co.uk/index.html and the topmost event listed here - http://www.rock-art-in-wales.co.uk/top/events.html

these people are massively experienced professionals that have interesting theories about rock art and have made important discoveries recently - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-wales-south-west-wales-14272126

so i have no idea whether i'll ever be a professional archaeologist but i'm going to have a damn good go at it. the first step is to get as much practical experience as possible. to that end i'll be volunteering at 2 local museums and engaging in 2 digs, including a medieval castle and a mesolithic flint-working site at my local beach (oh look, i have a fishing rod with me). in the end, and it may take years, someone may offer me a paid contract. 

the field school organised by the rock art people will be an important step in building my skill base as it will be an intensive course in various techniques over a 2 week period. i'm appalled at the cost as it must exclude lots of people who might like to go and have to throw myself at your mercy to raise funds.

needless to say i will be beyond happy if i'm successful.
