story:
What is Lawdible?

Lawdible is an Open Source software project that will help users and grass roots organizations manage the process of creating “Model Legislation" that can potentially become a law. The software will be apolitical (not favor any party or group) and will be free for anyone to download and use.

My goal for the Lawdible project is to create a working application and use that application to create a “draft bill” that I will submit to a local state representative for consideration in becoming a law.

Lawdible – Derived from the word Laudible meaning praiseworthy.

The lawdible system will help Grass Roots Organizations create Model Legislation by enabling them to: Research, Recruit, Draft, Submit, Promote & Share draft legislation.

The Need: Participation in creating and Modifying rules that govern your life. 

All communities need rules & regulations to help maintain order. Whether it is a virtual world/game, tenants association, club, local, state or federal government. This common set of rules can be as simple as verbal nonbinding agreements to Bills & laws are legal documents that are binding and require expertise in the law in order to draft properly.

Participation in our political process is out of reach of the average citizens.

Unlimited corporate campaign contributions, voters in non battle ground states votes don't matter, and legislation that is drafted by only the wealthiest of groups.  The process of creating laws has become complex to the point that citizens do not feel that they can play a part in the legislative process beyond signing petitions opposing proposed legislation.

Most legislation today is being drafted, not by the legislators themselves, but by well funded lobbyists and special interest groups.

One Example of Non Legislators Drafting Legislation

ALEC – The American Legislative Exchange Council, a 501(c)3 organization, for the past 35 years has been drafting "Model Legislation" for it's financial backers.   The organization recently in the news for drafting model legislation such as “Stand Your Ground”, “Voter ID Laws” and challenging the constitutionality of Obamacare, is funded by corporations and associations and brings in over $6 million annually to help draft business friendly legislation.  Each year over 1,000 bills are submitted to state legislatures based on ALEC "Model Legislation" with roughly 20% of those bills becoming laws.  Almost exclusively representing the interests of its corporate backers.

Who is creating Model legislation for that benefits people or groups who don't have the financial resources of ExxonMobil, BP or The American Bankers Association backing them? Insurance, Oil, pharmecutical, Banking these are all industries that can make or lose billions of dollars based on how legislation is worded. They can therefore spend tens if not hundreds of millions of dollars hiring experts (lobbyists) to help them pass the legislation that is beneficial to their cause or their industry.

THE SOLUTION:

Create an easy to use tool available to everyone, free of charge, that will facilitate the process of drafting legislation, and thereby leveling the playing field in terms of creating "Model Legislation".  What Word Press did for Blogging, Lawdible will do for legislation.

Lawdible will be both elegant in its design and ease of use.  The system will be intuitive and self explanatory.  Drag & Drop functionality & iconography will greatly increase the ease & time it takes to formulate well crafted legislation.

RESEARCH:

Search & Browse by Topic – Take Existing legislation that is well formulated, break it down into basic units. Sections, Paragraphs and sentences. Each segment can contain a brief plain English for its meaning, intent and scope.

Preexisting legislation library – Take Existing legislation that is well formulated, break it down into basic units. Sections, Paragraphs and sentences. Each segment can contain a brief plain English for its meaning, intent and scope.

DRAFT

Drag & Drop document construction. Sentences, paragraphs & sections can be taken from the preexisting legislation library, and can be added to create or amend a pending piece of legislation.

RECRUIT

Talent Pools where paid professionals & non-paid enthusiasts can lend their time and expertise to any projects.

REVISE & SUBMIT:

Peer Review - The ability to have 3rd parties make comments

Versioning System – All versions of the draft document are stored and reconstituted at a later date.

Legislative Ratings - The ability to have 3rd parties rate the legislation for thoroughness & legal standing

Import/Export - Lawdible file format where organizations can share documents that will automatically be deconstructed and added to the library for use in future documents.

Tools to Verify the legality & constitutionality of the legislation.

PROMOTE:

Once a working version of the Lawdible system is complete, I will create a "Draft Bill" using Lawdible and submit it to a local state representative.

SHARE:

Share the fruits of your hardwork and labor so that others can build on your success.  Once your Draft Legislation is complete, post it to the Lawdible Legislative Library so that other like minded people all over can apply what you've done.

story:
40% of all profits from book sales will go to Children at risk.

Persistaholic was written to help educate people, both young and old alike, on the right mindsets and beliefs to go out and accomplish the very difficult.

The book has two parts. The most important part is the belief & mindset sections, where beliefs are laid out and thought processes are detailed. The second portion is a true story about a young entrepreneur who defies substantial odds. The story is used to show what the beliefs and mindsets can accomplish.   

 

Why you should contribute

It's pretty simple, with the debt, wars, unemployment and other bleak things happening everyday, young people need to be reminded that things can and will get better, IF they go out and try to make things better. Their dreams do NOT have to go away, and it all starts with the education of the mind. With the correct foundation, anything is possible. Persistaholic, shows in detail a key component of the foundation.

Most self-published books including ebooks, sell very few copies. The simple reason for this is because they are not marketed. We feel that the message of the book is too important to stumble on this obstacle. We are seeking to avoid that blunder, and with your help we can. So please, contribute. Whether it is $5 or $500, every little bit helps.

 

Here is where we stand

$ 5,000 dollars will go to publishing costs. This includes a package from iUniverse, editing costs, graphic costs and other various things. 

Another $9,000 will go to building the website, creating a advertisement campaign around the slogan "I am a Persistaholic" and buying time & search terms in different media to get the word out. 

The remaining $1,000 will be applied to buying physical copies for distribution and the small first run of merchandising. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute you can still help. Read the book, visit the webpage www.persistaholic.com (once it's built) like the fan page on facebook, follow me on twitter @persistaholic. You can donate the book to people who could use the inspiration and beliefs. Just help spread the message that everything can and will improve, IF we each work at it. 

 

 

 

Here is a short excerpt from the book: 

Persistaholic, You Can’t Lose If You Don’tQuit is a belief system, the underlying soil, if you will, which enables individuals to undertake major ventures. I wrote this book for myself, however, take from it as you will. Use it to question your own make up of "soil." The thoughts and beliefs that have been poured into your mental construct and make you who you are. You see, contrary to popular opinion, you can control your own thoughts and propagate your construct for the better if you make a conscious choose to do so. It’s not easy, but it can be done with persistence and the right mindset. Use this book to till your “soil,” to challenge the beliefs you hold self-evident. Think, question, ponder, and if the mood strikes you, make a concerted effort to change, because adaptation is a must as the only absolute on Earth is change. 

 

Despair

Contrary to the aforementioned quote, Tristan was not off and running after he graduated college. In fact, he was close to stationary as possible. Each day his dreams seemed farther and farther away. He was unable to get momentum, let alone do anything productive. As bad as all the proceeding days were, this particular day was by far the worse.

The lights were off, the apartment was musky from the heat and the mold. Tristan’s body was tense. His head was in his hands with tears forming at the corner of his eyes. Every sensation and emotion was amplified. He could feel the fibers of the loose carpet between his toes. The apartment was confining and felt as if it were closing in on him. With clammy skin and a tense body, Tristan paced back and forth in the hallway of his dingy apartment trying to control his runaway mind. It had been a month since he quit the telemarketing job, one which he only held for a week.

There he was, unemployed, penniless, a new college graduate, friendless, in a new city, and in that moment, completely utterly hopeless. Not just hopeless where he did not know what to do, but rather, Tristan felt the type of despair where he actually had a physical reaction. The problem was Tristan seemed to be unable to act. He even consciously knew by not acting he would never get anywhere, let alone accomplish his dreams, but yet for some reason he still could not bring himself to act on those wants. Tristan was stuck in a rut, a very serious rut and his life after college was just starting. He had become his worse nightmare, he had become worse than an average college graduate in 2008. 

 

Don’t Tell Yourself You Can’t, Rather Ask Yourself, How Can You

The thoughts you have in your head have the greatest impact on the direction your life goes. What you can imagine, you can do. When faced with a situation where the first thought that goes through your head is “I can’t” catch yourself and rephrase the thought process to “how can I accomplish it?” With this simple change in your thoughts you will start to change your modality from not being in control to taking control in your situations and being able to affect the outcomes that previously you would have just let slip by. If you see a item you want but don’t have the money to buy it right that second, instead of saying “I can’t afford it” say “I how can I make the money to buy it.” Similarly, if you see an activity you want to do but think “you can’t,” change the statement around. The subtle change in your modality will have serious impact in your life. You will transform from someone who looks at problems and feels helpless to someone who can affect the problem and situation for the better. Ultimately, you become empowered rather than a victim. You will transform.

story:
- written by Jennifer Godwin in loving dedication to Andrew Green

Who is Andrew Green and why is he asking for money?

Andrew Green is a wonderful, kind and compassionate 26 year old male from Northern England. Since childhood, Andrew has shown a keen desire to help people and dreamed of one day becoming a doctor.

Working hard at school both academically and extra-curricularly, he became a straight-A student in order to meet the criteria that medical schools demand. However, his applications in 2008 were unsuccessful and he resultantly studied a related health-science degree in the hope he might gain access to Medical training in the future.

In 2012, it finally happened and he was accepted into the medical school at the University of Aberdeen.

That's all fine, well and lovely, but why does he need funding?

Unfortunately, that same year there was sudden and severe trebling of tuition fees (from £3,000 to £9,000 per year) and no subsequent increase in any financial support to Graduate students. This meant that a longer 5 year undergraduate course such as Medicine would cost roughly £45,000 in total, without costs of living and accommodation included. That put the reality of Andrew being able to attend Medical school in severe jeopardy.

Without financial assistance available, he worked 40+ hours a week alongside the full-time intensive Medicine course to attempt to raise these fees. The fees were not even remotely covered in this way, forcing Andrew to take a year off from studies and to recover from this near impossible situation. There was no support from the University either, which became punitive upon discovering the number of hours he was forced to work.

These circumstances are ridiculous. I am shocked at the treatment of this young, intelligent adult who wants to dedicate his life to a caring role in society. Please donate any financial aid you can to help Andrew so that he is not forced to leave medical school based on finances alone.

This fundraising is a plea for support of Andrew's continuation down the path he has struggled so hard to get on. It would be a crying shame for a fall at the last hurdle due to political bureaucracy. Your kind support will enable Andrew to continue his medical training and realise his long running dream of helping others.

story:
Founded by Olympic and NCAA athletes, ZGiRLS equips girls in sports with the tools & perspective they need to be CONFIDENT, CENTERED, & COURAGEOUS.

Every ZGiRLS Circle is matched with an inspirational female athlete Mentor in their area. Circles meet with their Mentor once per month from October through May.

 Female athletes everywhere agree: more girls need access to ZGiRLS!

After three years, we know one thing for sure:  ZGiRLS works. 

Participants walk away empowered, parents notice their daughters carrying themselves with more confidence, and Mentors LOVE volunteering for ZGiRLS.




So, what now? Help us bring ZGiRLS to girls across the country!




First and foremost, we need PARTICIPANTS because, well, without them, we wouldn't have any Circles… without MENTORS, we can’t deliver our proven curriculum... and without FUNDING, we can’t provide our amazing programming. You can help make ZGiRLS' national expansion possible!

PARTICIPANTS. One of the things that makes this campaign unique, is that parents can purchase early-bird ZGiRLS registration. Yep, even though 2015 ZGiRLS registration doesn't officially open until July 1st, parents can lock-in an early-bird registration fee right here on this campaign page. When this campaign closes, we will tell all early-bird registrants how to complete their registration on the ZGiRLS website. Do you know some parents of teenage girls? Let them know about this opportunity! (Trust us, they'll thank you later)

MENTORS. Chances are, you got to this page because someone sent you the link or you saw it online somewhere... Chances are, you also probably know some pretty awesome athletic women. Put the power of the internet, together with the amazing female athletes you know, and please help spread the word about ZGiRLS. Share this campaign so that we can grow our awesome team of female athlete mentors!

FUNDING! We are a startup nonprofit, and there's no way around it: we need money. We are committed to providing 10% of all ZGiRLS programs completely pro bono to girls who otherwise wouldn't have access... Not to mention, developing curricula, making instructional videos, and hosting webinars doesn't come without a cost. Every single dollar counts. Please BACK this campaign! Your contribution will make a difference.



Let us help you get a Circle started… TODAY! ZGiRLS will only be hosting 200 Circles across the country this year, so be sure to snag a registration spot via this campaign before it closes June 30th! Curious how this will work? Here’s a simple explanation:


HERE'S WHAT YOU GET BY PURCHASING A REGISTRATION PERK:

You do not need your Circle Captain or all of your Circle members nailed down before purchasing the perk!  Lock-in your daughter's spot by purchasing the registration perk today, then you can work on rounding up the other Circle members and identifying the Circle Captain over the next few weeks. 




MENTORSHIP

We believe, “if she can see it, she can be it.” That’s why we go great lengths to connect girls with our amazing female athlete Mentors (mostly collegiate level athletes or better). Over the course of ZGiRLS, girls gain perspective that can only come from someone who knows exactly what they’re going through. The relationship instills inspiration that lasts well beyond the Circle’s last Huddle.

EDUCATION

The ZGiRLS Compass Curriculum™ covers a range of topics, from mental awareness and body image, to stress management and goal-setting. A typical ZGiRLS Huddle includes short videos, discussions, self-reflective workbook exercises, and group activities. Girls apply and practice new ZGiRLS skills in between huddles with their “ZWORK” homework.

SUPPORT

ZGiRLS isn’t just a program – it’s a community, a resource, and a movement. Our eight-month annual program is designed to provide the continuity and reinforcement kids need to internalize new mental/emotional skills. From our parent workbooks and webinars, to our online articles, ZGiRLS is just as committed to supporting parents, coaches, and our Mentors, as we are to empowering girls.



Round up a group of 5-9 “sporty” girls ages 11-16 who are about the same age, preferably in the same sport. Designate a "Circle Captain" within your group of parents (or a coach). The Circle Captain is responsible for making sure that every participant within their Circle completes her registration. In September, ZGiRLS sends each Circle a kit of curriculums and pairs the Circle with a certified ZGiRLS Mentor in their area. Circles meet (“huddle”) with their Mentor once per month from October through May, progressing through the curriculum with the guidance and support of the nationwide ZGiRLS community.

(Graciously illustrated/designed by the talented www.lisabuckleyart.com)

Want more information about ZGiRLS? Perfect, we want to tell you more. Just go to our WEBSITE where we spell out everything you need to know to start and run a ZGiRLS Circle!



1.  SPORTS

Why does ZGiRLS work with girls in sports? Because it’s a huge population (6.8 million to be exact) and the statistics surrounding the benefits of sports are convincing: girls who do sports have higher self-esteem, are more likely to go to college, and in adulthood, they are more likely to rise into leadership roles. ZGiRLS supports girls in sports, so that they stay in sports.


2.  LIFE SKILLS

The Compass Curriculum™ teaches a wide variety of life-skills that prepare girls for success not only in their sport, but more importantly, in life. Valuable skills like goal-setting, stress management, communication, and positive self-talk can be transformational for young athletes, but most sports programs and coaches don’t have the time to teach these vital lessons. In ZGiRLS, girls don’t only learn about life-skills, they embody and practice them.


3.  EMPOWERMENT

From our uplifting culture, to our nationwide community, every ZGiRL has the inspiration and tools she needs to take control of her life and chase down her dreams. ZGiRLS across the country are united by a shared attitude of positivity and progress: ZERO limitations! Nothing holds a ZGiRL back from realizing her full potential.

SPORTS + LIFE SKILLS + EMPOWERMENT = a confident, centered, courageous ZGiRL



From media pressure to “mean girls,” ZGiRLS acknowledges that girls encounter a wide variety of external limitations. These obstacles are real, but rather than focusing our energy there, ZGiRLS chooses to turn within. ZGiRLS gives girls the tools they need to overcome their own internal barriers (the self-doubt, fear, and insecurity) so that they can navigate adolescence and graduate into adulthood with flourishing confidence, self-worth, and ambition… To live with ZERO internal limitations!



Your charitable contribution can help ZGiRLS make immediate impact on girls' lives. The perks listed in the right sidebar highlight the many programs, projects, and scholarships that your generous contributions will help make possible. As a 501(c)(3) organization, the perks – or a portion of the perk's value – are tax-deductible. For more details, please review our FAQ at the bottom of this page.



ZGiRLS was founded by Olympic and NCAA All-American athletes. Alongside our awesome Athlete Advisory Board (packed with professional athletes like Sue Bird, Gabby Reece, and Summer Sanders), our Professional Advisory Board (complete with psychologists, counselors, and curriculum developers), and our helpful Parent Advisory Board, our team is passionate about empowering and elevating the next generation of girls.

  • Libby Ludlow - Founder
  • Jilyne Higgins - Co-Founder
  • Jessica Khoshnood - Partnership Development
  • Kim Grant - Community Development
  • Cory Meyerson - Project Planning
  • Erin Stewart - Curriculum Development
  • Julie Vieselmeyer - Research & Development 
  • Lauren Ginder - Marketing & PR
  • Amanda McDonald - First Responder
  • Michelle Stamnes - Legal
  • Lisa Buckley - Graphic Design
  • Emma Langley - Social Media Intern



We just released the 4th edition of the ZGiRLS Compass Curriculum™. The curriculum is broken into monthly themes, and spread out over the course of eight months. ZGiRLS is designed to be a year-over-year program, progressing and building upon the lessons learned during the previous year. For more information about our transformational curriculum, be sure to check out our WEBSITE.

Wondering what the girls do at Huddles besides hang out with their Mentor? Huddles are usually a mix of short instructional videos, workbook exercises, discussions, games, and activities.  


$25 GOAL SETTING WORKSHOP PDF

Want to learn how to set SPUNKY™ goals? This PDF walks you through the ZGiRLS signature goal-setting method step-by-step. Ready to manifest something new and amazing in your life? This packet will help you break it down, plan it out, and get excited about your next big thing!


ZGiRLS TRUCKER HAT

Definitely our most popular apparel item! You know you can't go wrong with a trucker hat. Perfect, rain or shine. 

One size fits all, adjustable back.


ZGiRLS ACTIVYST T-SHIRT

ZGiRLS is excited to partner with women's apparel company Activyst to make these custom ZGiRLS tee's available to our campaign backers! Trust us, this tee is so comfy you won't want to take it off. DREAM. BELIEVE. DO. REPEAT... Um, yes please. 

After our campaign closes on June 30th, you will be asked to complete a survey and report which size you'd like. In the meantime, if you're curious about sizing, there is more information below in the FAQ.


$89 ZGiRLS PARTICIPANT REGISTRATION

Snag your exclusive early-bird ZGiRLS registration for 2015! We are only hosting 200 Circles this year, so don't hesitate to secure a spot for your daughter and her friends! This limited perk provides the opportunity to lock-in a special early-bird registration rate.* After this campaign closes, we will tell you everything you need to know in order to complete the registration process. 

(If you're antsy and want a preview, here's how it'll work: Do you know what Groupon is? If you do, this perk is kind of like that…  We will provide you with a unique promo code to redeem when you complete registration on the ZGiRLS website, after it opens on July 1st.) 

*The standard ZGiRLS registration fee is $99/participant.


$1,195 ZGiRLS SUMMER ADVENTURE CAMP

Help your daughter find a stronger sense of self and discover her limitless potential! This camp is the perfect mix of adventure, personal development, and FUN!

  • July 12th - July 18th
  • Hood River, Oregon
  • Ages 11-13
  • All inclusive (except for travel to/from Hood River)
  • Physical activities include: white water rafting, rock climbing, wind surfing, standup paddling, mountain biking, yoga
  • Personal development, ZGiRLS Compass Curriculum™, Journaling, Leadership 

Truly the ultimate summer experience! At our 2015 Summer Adventure Camp, girls will have the opportunity to build confidence experientially by challenging their limits on a daily basis. Through mindful progressions, supportive teamwork, and tough physical activities like rock climbing, river rafting, windsurfing, and mountain biking, girls will walk away with one of the most fun, empowering, and confidence-building experiences of their lives. Don't miss this special opportunity!

For more information about the camp, please visit THIS PAGE on our website!


$10,000 PARK CITY SKI WEEKEND 

Skiers! Don't miss this is a once-in-a-lifetime kind of deal!

  • 2 nights-stay for a family of 4 at the Montage Deer Valley
  • 2 POC Helmets (size and color of your preference)
  • 2 ski tunes at Cole Sport
  • 4 lift tickets to Deer Valley Resort
  • Two days skiing with U.S. Olympian & ZGiRLS Founder Libby Ludlow

Montage Deer Valley is an authentic yet refined mountain retreat set amidst the wooded valleys and uncluttered slopes above Park City, Utah. Occupying a coveted location within the Deer Valley Resort (#1 Ski Mountain in North America) and less than 45 minutes from Salt Lake City International Airport, this resort offer true ski-in / ski-out access, 174 guest rooms and suites (all with fireplaces), extensive amenities including a 35,000 sq ft. Spa, indoor and outdoor pools, ski concierge, inspired dining, renowned service, and even bowling located within the onsite Pub. Travel and airfare not included. [Total Fair Market Value: $5,600]

TERMS & CONDITIONS: Item expires May 1st, 2016.  Blackout dates: Dec 20 - Jan 4; Jan 16-19; Jan 22 - Feb 1; Feb 13-23; Mar 14-22; Apr 13-30. Dates must also be mutually agreed upon by Libby according to her availability (which shouldn't be difficult.) Travel and transportation not included.



Website: www.zgirls.org

Email: support@zgirls.org

Facebook: www.facebook.com/goZGiRLS

Instagram: www.instagram.com/goZGiRLS

Twitter: www.twitter.com/goZGiRLS #IndiegoZGiRLS #goZGiRLS #MakeCourageContagious

Pinterest: www.pinterest.com/goZGiRLS

Learn more about our team: www.zgirls.org/team



This campaign has been made possible thanks to the generous support of our partners.



Do you have questions about ZGiRLS Circles? Understanding how ZGiRLS Circles work can be confusing at first.  Please visit our WEBSITE for everything you need to know, and don't miss the long list of frequently asked questions! 


HOW LONG WILL IT TAKE TO COMPLETE THE “GOAL-SETTING WORKSHOP” AND WHEN WILL I GET IT?

The packet is self-guided so you can spend as much, or as little, time on it as you’d like. When we run live goal setting workshops, it takes about an hour to work through the packet. We will email you your PDF shortly after the campaign closes on June 30th.


WHEN WILL I RECEIVE MY ZGiRLS HAT/SHIRT?

Backers will likely receive their trucker hats around the end of July, and t-shirts will likely ship around the end of August. That said, we’re new to selling merchandise and acknowledge the possibility that orders may take longer than expected. We promise we’ll do our best to deliver your perks as quickly as possible. 


IS MY DONATION TAX DEDUCTIBLE?

ZGiRLS is a Washington-based 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization (federal tax ID #47-1091362).  This IRS publication says “Generally, you can deduct contributions of money or property you make to, or for the use of, a qualified organization.”  However, that same publication lists many exceptions, conditions and limitations.  We are not tax experts, and you should consult your own advisors on the extent to which you can deduct charitable contributions from your taxable income. 


CAN MY DONATION BE MATCHED BY MY EMPLOYER?

Yes!  If your employer has a donation matching program, PLEASE do follow up and request that your employer match your donation.


CAN I CONTROL HOW ZGIRLS SPENDS MY DONATION?

No, not generally.  While we have spelled out types of activities that can be funded as a result of certain levels of donations, we hope that donors trust that we are trustworthy stewards and are using all contributions to support the ZGiRLS mission.  We provide reports and accounting of how we spend contributions and the impact those contributions are making.  This being said, if you are really interested in making a significant contribution for a very specific purpose, please don’t hesitate to contact us!


WHAT IF I PURCHASE THE BIG PARK CITY TRIP, AND DON’T END UP BEING ABLE TO MAKE IT ON THE DATES ARRANGED?

Being a ski trip, it can only be used during the winter season.  We all know that winter weather and snow conditions are unpredictable. And, given that accommodations were generously donated by a hotel that needs to manage holiday bookings, there are certain dates that are unavailable.  Before purchasing the trip, carefully consider the blackout dates. If for any reason you end up not being able to make the trip, you may give it to someone else to use according to the same terms.  If nobody ends up using the trip, we cannot give you a refund of any portion of what you paid.  However, you may be able to treat the entire amount as a tax-deductible donation (consult your advisor!) Estimated retail value of trip = $5,600


WHAT’S UP WITH THE NAME ZGiRLS?

ZGiRLS founder Libby Ludlow wanted the organization’s name to be tied to her overarching vision, which is to create a world where nothing holds girls back from chasing their dreams. ZGiRLS aspires to help girls knock down all internal barriers and operate from a place of ZERO limitations. What holds a ZGiRL back from realizing her limitless potential? Zip, zero, zilch!!


I DON’T UNDERSTAND HOW ZGiRLS WORKS, CAN YOU EXPLAIN?

Sure! If you don’t mind, take a trip over to our WEBSITE for a complete run-down  of what ZGiRLS does and how it works. While you’re there, don’t miss the extensive FAQ that answers pretty much every questions under the sun about our programs.

No, not generally.  While we have spelled out types of activities that can be funded as a result of certain levels of donations, we hope that donors trust that we are trustworthy stewards and are using all contributions to support the ZGiRLS mission.  We provide reports and accounting of how we spend contributions and the impact those contributions are making.  This being said, if you are really interested in making a significant contribution for a very specific purpose, please don’t hesitate to contact us!

WHAT IF I PURCHASE THE BIG PARK CITY TRIP, AND DON’T END UP BEING ABLE TO MAKE IT ON THE DATES ARRANGED?
Being a ski trip, it can only be used during the winter season.  We all know that winter weather and snow conditions are unpredictable. And, given that accommodations were generously donated by a hotel that needs to manage holiday bookings, there are certain dates that are unavailable.  Before purchasing the trip, carefully consider the blackout dates. If for any reason you end up not being able to make the trip, you may give it to someone else to use according to the same terms.  If nobody ends up using the trip, we cannot give you a refund of any portion of what you paid.  However, you may be able to treat the entire amount as a tax-deductible donation (consult your advisor!) Estimated retail value of trip = $5,600



WHAT’S UP WITH THE NAME ZGiRLS?ZGiRLS founder Libby Ludlow wanted the organization’s name to be tied to her overarching vision, which is to create a world where nothing holds girls back from chasing their dreams. ZGiRLS aspires to help girls knock down all internal barriers and operate from a place of ZERO limitations. What holds a ZGiRL back from realizing her limitless potential? Zip, zero, zilch!!
I DON’T UNDERSTAND HOW ZGiRLS WORKS, CAN YOU EXPLAIN?Sure! If you don’t mind, take a trip over to our WEBSITE for a complete run-down  of what ZGiRLS does and how it works. While you’re there, don’t miss the extensive FAQ that answers pretty much every questions under the sun about our programs.

story:
Short Summary

Our Youth Group, at First Parish, is in its 10th year and is made up of high school students from Needham, Massachusetts and surrounding communities.  Our group provides opportunities for youth to connect, explore healthy personal choices, build community, and live out our organization's principles, most visibly through social justice and service work.

Each year, the Youth Group raises funds to travel somewhere we can volunteer with local organizations working to make a difference in their communities. In April 2015, we are excited to be traveling to Eastern Tennessee for a week, where the youth will do a variety of projects related to environmentalism and nature in Great Smoky Mountains National Park. 

What We Need

The youth at First Parish work year long on fundraising efforts that help with the cost of housing and food for 15 youth and chaperones.  Our campaign goal to raise $2000 will help cover additional costs associated with the trip, like transportation to Tennessee from Massachusetts, gas, and other incidentals.  Any assistance from our friends, families, and others will go a long way in helping us to be excellent ambassadors of First Parish in Needham and wonderful examples of the power and compassion of Youth everywhere.

The Impact

While the youth give significantly in their time and labor, the benefits of this service trip are immense and lasting for us as well.  We gain tremendous insight and empathy for a community that is quite different from our own and begin to understand the role that issues like race and class play in creating inequities.  In fact, we are often inspired to take up with further social justice work when we return home and many of graduates of our youth program actively seek out volunteer and professional work where they can continue to be a positive force for social change.

story:
The Art & Publication class taught by faculty Holly Tempo is raising funds for the 2015 Fine Arts BFA Exhibition catalog at Otis College of Art & Design.  This is an annual endeavor where students in the class collaborate with a graphic designer to create a professional archive of graduating seniors' artwork.  This project teaches students about all phases of catalog production. The catalog provides the opportunity for emerging artists to develop a professional presence as they complete their studies and enter the art world. 

The funds are needed for design, materials, and printing costs.  Our budget this year is half of what is required, so we must raise additional funds to maintain professional-level standards and successfully complete the project. 

We will keep you posted on our progress throughout this campaign.

story:
My name is Peter Tomasovic and I work in field of education and consultancy. My girlfriend has a brother. Younger 14 years old boy. When I talk to him about school, he tells me: "I hate school!" or "It is boring and they are stu*id!". But he is very clever, he just don't like reading books or staring at pictures at school. He likes something else. He likes to learn english …. during playing World of warcraft! He likes electrotechnics and he build his own speakers. He repaired old cell phone … and sold it to his classmates and earned some money. 

Kids and young people are not stupid, they just grow faster than current educational system.

explain3D - explain in 3D, how things work

Goal of the project is to create system of educational simulations, where people can play with basic mechanisms and tools in 3D environment and understand, how things work. System is using principles of game based learning and interactive education, so learning how car engine works is like playing Need for speed. System will be motivating young people to technical education and making technical education and technical and vocational education and training fun and more interesting.

Where are we now?

We have created prototype of system with first simulations. 3 of these simulations were based on suggestions of educators. Currently, the system has only 10 simulations. You can see our progress on the website of the project explain3d.com.

Where we want to get?

  1. Develop 8 complex simulations
  2. Redesign of user interface for better experience
  3. Create virtual museum of inventors

1. Develop 8 complex simulations

Our primary goal is to create 8 complex simulations from field of mechanics, transportation and physics. List of all simulations shows picture below. 

2. Redesign of user interface for better experience

For better experience from education, we would like to make some small redesigns of web and user interface of simulations:

  • graphic user interface of simulations,
  • website optimization (faster load, mobile web page support),
  • website graphics redesign.

3. Virtual museum of inventors

We would like to create virtual museum of inventors (3D models of inventors) with descriptions of their most valuable inventions, that changed the world 

  1. Archimedes (287 BC –  212 BC), 
  2. Johannes Gutenberg (1394-1468),
  3. Leonardo Da Vinci (1452 – 1519),
  4. Galileo (1564-1642),
  5. Benjamin Franklin (1706-1790),
  6. James Watt (1736 – 1819),
  7. Thomas Edison (1847-1931),
  8. Alexander Graham Bell (1847-1869),
  9. The Wright Brothers,
  10. Nikola Tesla (1856 –1943),
  11. Henry Ford (1863-1947),
  12. YOU - see perk "Leonardo da Vinci".

What if we don't reach our funding goal? 

We will thank to all contributors, who supported us and we will make as much as possible with raised money. Primary goal are simulations - create as much simulations as possible, to create useful tool for all students and educators.

Other ways of help

Money are the best way of support. But if you can afford to support us this way, we will be happy for any other way of support. 

We made a search and analysis on internet and we did not find a similar tool. There is a lot of written about gamification in education, but there is no similar tool - small simulations in 3D environment. 

Therefore, most valuable for us is promotion. If you are writing a blog, or using social media, you could help us by sharing our ideas. If you need more pictures, special materials or articles, feel free to contact me:

  • our website: explain3d.com,
  • facebook page: facebook.com/explain3d,
  • mail: peter@explain3d.com.

explain3D - simple app in the world

Explain3d is a simple web application and for using this tool, you need only internet connection and browser. Therefore its simple tool that can be used all over the world. It's a great option for less developed countries or small schools and technical institutions. We would like to create education fun and more interactive for everyone. And why crowdfunding? Because we need you - teachers, educators, and fans of interactive education to create useful tool!

Thank you!

Thank you very much for your support and contribution from explain3d team:

Peter Tomasovic, Marian Kosa, Michal Ozaniak, Pavol Humaj, Alino Haviar :).

story:
What is Kula's Royal Curry?

Kula’s Royal Curry is the flagship product of Kula’s Organic Foods, a company started by Brynden McNew and Trevor Forbess in Portland, Oregon.  Specializing in spice blends, they have been experimenting with the world's finest flavors for many years.  The recipe for Kula’s Royal Curry is the legacy left behind by their close friend Kula.  He inherited the recipe from a monastery kitchen in India where he worked for many years as a chef.


Why are we using crowdfunding?

The purpose of this Indiegogo campaign is to help Brynden and Trevor pay their tuition for a class called “Getting Your Recipe To Market”.  In partnership with New Seasons Markets, the Food Innovation Center and Portland Community College, this class will teach Brynden and Trevor everything about being a successful food entrepreneur.  At the end of the course, New Seasons Markets selects one product from the program to be sold in their stores.  By donating, you’ll be helping Brynden and Trevor get one step closer to winning the competition with Kula’s Royal Curry.  Here is what we'll be learning...

What We Need & What You Get

In order for Brynden and Trevor to pay their tuition, they’re reaching out to YOU!  Continuing education is an important and noble cause.  They need $3,850 to pay for the class with one round of product samples for rewards and postage. They have a number of different rewards that will keep you connected with their journey through this program.  By donating, you'll be apart of the team. Not only will you be able to taste Kula's Royal Curry before anyone else, but you'll be included in blog updates, video posts, and new recipes.

The Impact

Our ancient 10 spice blend brings the spirit of India to the heart of the Northwest.  Having a local source of exotic flavor and culture will greatly benefit the shelves of our markets and the plates of our families.  If you’re unable to donate, you can still help by spreading the word and sharing this campaign with your friends and family. So Join us and discover wellness!

story:
Who We Are

The Poetry Center of Chicago is a non-profit organization that has been providing public poetry readings since 1974. For the past twenty years, the PCC has provided the Hands On Stanzas program for Chicago Public Schools. 

Hands On Stanzas sends Chicago poets into classrooms for twenty-week residencies. Over the course of a residency, each Poet-In-Residence develops a strong relationship with their students, building trust and encouraging self-expression.

Each session involves reading published poetry and asking students to write and perform their own original poetry. Our Poets In Residence publish exceptional student poems weekly on the residency blogs.

Each year, our students show not only an increase in literacy and comprehension, but they self-report increased confidence in reading, writing, and self-expression. Weekly publications of their work help students see the value in their creative thinking and allow them to share their poems with family, teachers, and the community.

Our program provides a number of creative cultural opportunities outside of the classroom as well. Last year, our students performed in a Teen Poetry Reading at the Chicago Public Library's beautiful Harold Washington Library, and last month our students performed original poems live on stage at the Chicago Symphony Orchestra!

Every year, we honor our talented students at the All Schools Reading, a final celebration of a year of poetry well done. One student from each residency classroom reads in the beautiful Claudia Cassidy theater at the Chicago Cultural Center. We invite you to come see our program in action! April 29th, 5:30 - 7pm, Claudia Cassidy Theater, Chicago Cultural Center, 78 East Washington Street, Chicago, Illinois.



This year, Hands On Stanzas has residencies in over 30 classrooms, writing poetry with nearly 1,000 students. With your help, we look forward to working with even more students next year!


The Impact of Empowering Creative Voices

Our program creates passion in our students, an outlet for expression, and the confidence to find their voices. We all know being young is tough, even in the best circumstances. And in a testing-focused environment, Hands On Stanzas is sometimes the only moment of creative expression during a regular school day.

You already know the research on how creative thinking and expression improve so many of our skills. So instead, here's a few folks on what the program means to them:



Our Challenges

Funding a non-profit is always a challenge. The Poetry Center has survived 40 years of ups and downs, and we are ready to face the next 40 providing important services to Chicago's students.

Our biggest challenge right now is to spread the word. If you believe in this campaign, please tell people about it, and extend awareness of our program.


Spread The Word & Help Our Community Grow!

Helping us spread the word is vital and in return receives our endless gratitude! If you feel Hands On Stanzas provides a valuable service to the community please spread the word: talk to your friends and family about us, share the campaign page via email and social media. Spreading our base is a crucial part of crowdfunding this community service.

Insider tip! Using the share buttons on this campaign page (you'll find them on the left side or at the top of the page) lets Indiegogo know that we have fans. Thanks, team!


It's A Bird, It's A Plane, Its...












F.A.Q.

Q: Will my donations be tax deductible?

A: Yes! After donating, you should receive an email from FirstGiving confirming the tax-deductible status of your contribution.

Q: Does my donation have to match my perk choice?

A: Nope! You may select a perk, and donate additional money (thank you for asking!) above that perk level. Click "Select a Perk" to choose a perk and donation level.

Q: Do all donations include an online thank you?

A: Yes! All donation levels above $10 include your name in our donor list at www.poetrycenter.org and a shout out on PCC social media.

Q: Are the perks listed the only ones that will be available? 

A: Nope! We're able to post 20 perks at a time and will be rotating them regularly. Perks that will be revolving include Chicago neighborhood theme packs with gift certificates and tours, signed books and broadsides, and other exciting offers. Stay tuned!

Q: I'm excited about one of your current limited edition perks, but also curious about what's next--can I donate more than once?

A: Pshyeah!!! You may donate as many times as you'd like. And thank you.

Q: Can I see pictures of the perks?

A: Absolutely! Check out the perks section above or view the hi-res pictures in our image gallery. (Click on the "Gallery" tab at the top of this page.)

Q: Who made your super awesome video?

A: Great question! Massive thanks to our amazing crew:

Salvo Advertising: http://www.salvoadvertising.com/
Catalyst Lighting: http://catalystlightingchicago.com/
For Music:  "Music by audionautix.com"

Q: Where can I say hello & ask additional questions?

A: Say hello and send all queries over to info@poetrycenter.org


Thank You!

We can't say it enough: thank you for your support, in all forms. Thank you for supporting poetry in the community!

story:
* Video trailer from the recent movie Library of the Early Mind, a fantastic film about why children's book authors and illustrators do what we do.

Serving the Hearts of Children

Do you remember how you saw the world as a child? How every eventâ€”and the emotions wrapped up in themâ€”was so magnified? The greatest belly-laughs, and the copious tears. Those of us who are parents or who work with children can think back to our own childhoods and realize that one of the greatest things we can do for kids is to help them organize, embrace and master their emotional lives. That is my heart for children, and in my own childhood, books were my greatest teachers.

In my own illustration work, and in the books I develop, I seek to create pictures and stories in which kids will lose themselves, come back again and again, and find new inspiration, even as they grow into adulthood. In my books, I want kids to connect to a sense that they are understood, that the world is as mysterious and magical as they think it is, and that books of all kinds are a safe place to work things out as they navigate childhood.

My Trip to Ireland and Scotland

For the first part of my journey, I have the opportunity to serve with Troy and Noelle Rhodes as they work with kids in the Shankill area of Belfast, Northern Ireland. The Rhodesâ€™ work with a mission called Go Kidz!, which seeks to bring hope to at-risk youth in the schools, as they gather late at night in parks, and through various other outreaches. Kids in Belfast tend to be especially at risk of problems like teen pregnancy and paramilitary involvement. There is around an 18% rate of unemployment among youth between 18-24, and a huge problem with early alcoholism. As a result, kids often turn to the paramilitary for a sense of belonging, further perpetuating the divisions that this city has historically experienced. See this video for more about what Go Kidz! does in Belfast: http://vimeo.com/9251072

Over the course of several days, Iâ€™ll be working with kids from elementary through high school in group art projects and introductory art therapy, as well as speaking to adults about how literacy and the arts can serve kids in every area of their lives, both to close the achievement gap and to promote higher aspirations. A large part of my program will involve empowering teens as leaders. If I raise funds over and above my practical needs, I plan to bring a small library of excellent books to donate to the program.

The second part of my trip involves research for a wordless graphic novel Iâ€™m developing. Iâ€™ve been working on books for years, and just had my second book published with MeeGenius ebooks. The book Iâ€™m working on now is by far the most precious and personal to me. Set in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland, the book deals with issues of family secrets, ways of communicating beyond words, the indissoluble bond of mother-love, forgiveness...and sea birds. Lots of them. You can see samples of the work, and read more about the process, on my website, www.vespersongs.com.

It became important in the course of developing this book to pursue a research trip in order to get a more accurate understanding of Hebridean culture, landscape and wildlife. As well, the book is taking me further into my own Scotch-Irish heritage and the past of myself and my ancestors. I believe so much in this story that it warrants physically delving deep into the inspiration behind it.

What I Need & What You Get

I can truly say that I have some of the most generous and large-hearted friends. So many of you have given lavishly to the work that my husband and I do. You are true patronsâ€”not only of the arts, but of hope. When I come back from this trip and show you all, both immediately and over time, the fruit you had a hand in producing, I hope you'll have a sense that you were there, too.

My basic needs for this tripâ€”travel, lodging, meals and suppliesâ€”come to approximately $3000*. However, I would like to raise up to $5000 in order to cover the income my family needs while I am away, including childcare so my husband doesn't have to miss his own work.

If I do not raise at least $3000, I will have to postpone my trip until Iâ€™m able to raise it all, which means that my book will be very delayed in getting to agents and editors, and I will have to sit on my hands and not bring my offering to the kids in Belfast. As freelance artists, my husband and I do not have salaries or vacation time to fall back on. Every cent I raise is a cent that does not need to come at my familyâ€™s expense. And every cent you donate is one that will make a difference in the lives of kids, both tangibly and in ways you and I can only dream of.

To say thank you for your help, Iâ€™m offering many gifts, from a set of bird ornaments to hang in your window, to copies of my previously published book, to original art based on my book, to a hard-bound keepsake book of the trip containing photos and artwork by myself and the kids in Belfast. Gifts abound!

Other Ways You Can Help
I know that you believe as I do that two transformative elements in kidsâ€™ lives are one-on-one time and reading. If you feel as strongly about that as I do, consider how you can help me in my mission.

The single most important thing you can do for me is to pray for effectiveness in my goal to serve both the kids of Belfast and the kids who will read my book. Then consider how you can put your financial gift behind the work I'm undertaking.

Beyond that, I ask you to take advantage of social media to spread the word to as many people as you possibly can. A personal invitation to give means more than a general wall post or tweet. Can you think of at least ten people with whom to share this mission who would be able to give generously? A personal email from you, a phonecall, a message, or a card would go far to help.

Thank you for believing in this work, and for supporting me! Now, let's reap the joy of serving kids together!

*(Iâ€™m setting the IndieGoGo amount lower so that if I donâ€™t meet it, I can still recoup the maximum amount with their fees.)
story_txt: * Video trailer from the recent movie Library of the Early Mind, a fantastic film about why children's book authors and illustrators do what we do.Serving the Hearts of ChildrenDo you remember how you saw the world as a child? How every eventâ€”and the emotions wrapped up in themâ€”was so magnified? The greatest belly-laughs, and the copious tears. Those of us who are parents or who work with children can think back to our own childhoods and realize that one of the greatest things we can do for kids is to help them organize, embrace and master their emotional lives. That is my heart for children, and in my own childhood, books were my greatest teachers.In my own illustration work, and in the books I develop, I seek to create pictures and stories in which kids will lose themselves, come back again and again, and find new inspiration, even as they grow into adulthood. In my books, I want kids to connect to a sense that they are understood, that the world is as mysterious and magical as they think it is, and that books of all kinds are a safe place to work things out as they navigate childhood. My Trip to Ireland and ScotlandFor the first part of my journey, I have the opportunity to serve with Troy and Noelle Rhodes as they work with kids in the Shankill area of Belfast, Northern Ireland. The Rhodesâ€™ work with a mission called Go Kidz!, which seeks to bring hope to at-risk youth in the schools, as they gather late at night in parks, and through various other outreaches. Kids in Belfast tend to be especially at risk of problems like teen pregnancy and paramilitary involvement. There is around an 18% rate of unemployment among youth between 18-24, and a huge problem with early alcoholism. As a result, kids often turn to the paramilitary for a sense of belonging, further perpetuating the divisions that this city has historically experienced. See this video for more about what Go Kidz! does in Belfast: http://vimeo.com/9251072Over the course of several days, Iâ€™ll be working with kids from elementary through high school in group art projects and introductory art therapy, as well as speaking to adults about how literacy and the arts can serve kids in every area of their lives, both to close the achievement gap and to promote higher aspirations. A large part of my program will involve empowering teens as leaders. If I raise funds over and above my practical needs, I plan to bring a small library of excellent books to donate to the program.The second part of my trip involves research for a wordless graphic novel Iâ€™m developing. Iâ€™ve been working on books for years, and just had my second book published with MeeGenius ebooks. The book Iâ€™m working on now is by far the most precious and personal to me. Set in the Outer Hebrides of Scotland, the book deals with issues of family secrets, ways of communicating beyond words, the indissoluble bond of mother-love, forgiveness...and sea birds. Lots of them. You can see samples of the work, and read more about the process, on my website, www.vespersongs.com.It became important in the course of developing this book to pursue a research trip in order to get a more accurate understanding of Hebridean culture, landscape and wildlife. As well, the book is taking me further into my own Scotch-Irish heritage and the past of myself and my ancestors. I believe so much in this story that it warrants physically delving deep into the inspiration behind it.What I Need & What You GetI can truly say that I have some of the most generous and large-hearted friends. So many of you have given lavishly to the work that my husband and I do. You are true patronsâ€”not only of the arts, but of hope. When I come back from this trip and show you all, both immediately and over time, the fruit you had a hand in producing, I hope you'll have a sense that you were there, too.My basic needs for this tripâ€”travel, lodging, meals and suppliesâ€”come to approximately $3000*. However, I would like to raise up to $5000 in order to cover the income my family needs while I am away, including childcare so my husband doesn't have to miss his own work.If I do not raise at least $3000, I will have to postpone my trip until Iâ€™m able to raise it all, which means that my book will be very delayed in getting to agents and editors, and I will have to sit on my hands and not bring my offering to the kids in Belfast. As freelance artists, my husband and I do not have salaries or vacation time to fall back on. Every cent I raise is a cent that does not need to come at my familyâ€™s expense. And every cent you donate is one that will make a difference in the lives of kids, both tangibly and in ways you and I can only dream of.To say thank you for your help, Iâ€™m offering many gifts, from a set of bird ornaments to hang in your window, to copies of my previously published book, to original art based on my book, to a hard-bound keepsake book of the trip containing photos and artwork by myself and the kids in Belfast. Gifts abound!Other Ways You Can HelpI know that you believe as I do that two transformative elements in kidsâ€™ lives are one-on-one time and reading. If you feel as strongly about that as I do, consider how you can help me in my mission.The single most important thing you can do for me is to pray for effectiveness in my goal to serve both the kids of Belfast and the kids who will read my book. Then consider how you can put your financial gift behind the work I'm undertaking.Beyond that, I ask you to take advantage of social media to spread the word to as many people as you possibly can. A personal invitation to give means more than a general wall post or tweet. Can you think of at least ten people with whom to share this mission who would be able to give generously? story:
Keep Hicham in school

He will not be able to complete his course of study without our help!

(Texte en français au bas de la page)

The story

In 2009, my travels led me to Morocco, where I was blessed to stay with a wonderful family and where I truly connected with a new brother, Hicham. Thanks to them, I felt nurtured in the midst of what became a big life transition. Through my unsettling culture shock, Hicham offered guidance and helped me to grow as an individual. Ever since then, we have kept contact like members of a real family. Today, my brother needs my help, but I cannot do it alone.

 

A little more about Hicham

Above all, Hicham is dedicated to offering local children accessible eye care and his greatest dream is to be of service in his hometown, near his parents and siblings, and start a family of his own.  Since I’ve known him, Hicham has used every opportunity to volunteer in his community and help anyone he is able to (including me).  A passionate and intelligent 29 year old, he is now focused on studying orthoptics, a type of vision therapy that has never been taught in Morocco before. As part of a pioneering cohort of students, he will work with children with eye muscle disorders, widening the range of treatment options where accessibility to healthcare can be a challenge.   

 

The financial reality

Amazingly, $300 USD/CAD per month pays for tuition, rent, food and transportation for Hicham while he’s studying in Rabat. He has tried everything to find funding, but things don’t work the same way in Morocco. There are no such things as student loans or student jobs. We are his only option now. Really, what is $300 for us? Or even $100? And $10? He needs our help for 18 months of school, so let’s raise $5400 together and allow him to pursue his dream!

 

Why give today?

To help my brother, to help me, and to allow a dream to come true.  Once we have understood what it means to rely on another person during a trying time, we are eager to return the love that was shown to us.  With the solution at the tip of my fingers, I’m asking you to give today.  For him to be able to help kids in his community.  For him to have a family of his own. To pass along to others the kindnesses shown to us.

 

Every little bit helps!

 

Thank you sincerely

 

_____________________________________________

 

Gardons Hicham à l’école

Il ne pourra pas compléter ses études sans nous!

L’histoire

En 2009, mes voyages m’ont emmenée au Maroc, où j’ai eu la chance d’être accueillie par une famille exceptionnelle et où je me suis liée d’une amitié fraternelle avec Hicham. Grâce à eux, j’ai reçu tout le support dont j’ai eu besoin au milieu de ce qui est devenu une grande transition dans ma vie. Hicham a agit comme un frère pour moi, offrant son soutien durant ce choc culturel et transformationnel, et il m’a vraiment aidée à évoluer en tant que personne. Nous sommes toujours restés en contact comme les membres d’une véritable famille. Aujourd’hui, mon frère marocain a vraiment besoin de mon aide, mais je ne peux y arriver toute seule.

 

Au sujet d’Hicham

Par dessus tout, Hicham est dédié à rendre accessible les soins des yeux aux enfants de sa communauté et son plus grand rêve est de le faire dans sa ville natale, là où il veut fonder sa propre famille auprès de ses parents et de ses frères et sœurs. Depuis que je le connais, il a toujours su maximiser chaque opportunité de pouvoir aider les autres en dévouant son temps et son soutien autant que possible, tout comme il l’a fait pour moi. Hicham est un jeune homme passionné et intelligent, maintenant sérieusement concentré sur ses études en orthoptie. Une pratique nouvellement enseignée au Maroc, il s’agit d’un secteur de l'ophtalmologie qui étudie et traite les troubles visuels par rééducation. Faisant partie du premier groupe d’étudiants en ce domaine, Hicham travaillera avec les enfants qui ont des problèmes de vision, aidant à rendre ce type the thérapie plus accessible à tous.

 

La réalité financière

Hicham a besoin de seulement 300$ USD/CAN par mois pour couvrir tous les frais liés à ses études, incluant les frais de scolarité, le logement, la nourriture ainsi que le transport. Hicham a fait beaucoup d’efforts afin de trouver les sommes requises pour pouvoir compléter ses études, mais les choses fonctionnent bien différemment au Maroc. Il n’y a pas de programmes de support aux études tel que des prêts et bourses ou même du travail pour les étudiants, comme chez nous. Nous sommes sa seule option à ce point. Il a besoin de notre aide pour une période de 18 mois d’étude, ce qui représente le temps nécessaire afin de pouvoir graduer. À $300/mois il aura besoin d’amasser $5,400, ce qui lui permettra de réaliser son rêve et fonder sa propre famille. Qu’est-ce que $300 pour nous, ou $100 ou même $10 ? Toute contribution est la bienvenue !

 

Pourquoi donner aujourd’hui?

Pour aider mon frère, pour m’aider moi et pour aider à ce que le rêve d’Hicham devienne réalité. Parce que nous avons reçu l’aide inestimable d’une personne durant des moments difficiles de notre vie, nous comprenons l’importance d’être là pour s’aider les uns les autres. Avec cette solution au bout de nos doigts, je vous demande de contribuer dès aujourd’hui pour qu’Hicham puisse aider les enfants de sa communauté. Pour qu’il puisse fonder sa propre famille. Pour partager avec les autres la bonté qui nous a été offert.

 

Merci sincèrement!

story:
The Lubuto Library Project

The Lubuto Library Project, founded in 2005, creates high quality, public libraries to serve Africa's vulnerable children and youth. Founded and guided by professional librarians, Lubuto believes that investment in libraries is necessary as a part of a comprehensive approach to youth empowerment and poverty reduction in Africa. 

To date, Lubuto has built three libraries in Zambia for children and youth, each hosted by a different Zambian organization. These host organizations own and shape how the library fits into and serves their communities.  After creating and stocking the libraries, Lubuto's role is to build capacity: we train librarians and ensure staff are able to effectively reach out and welcome the most marginalized youth to the library. Building this local ownership and professional capacity is central to Lubuto, and crucial to improving a sustainable future for public libraries in Africa as spaces for education, community and development. 

Thomas Mukonde is a terrific example of the leadership and ownership we are building. Lubuto believes that supporting his professional education is the key to the future not only of Lubuto, but of children's libraries across the continent. 

Who is Thomas Mukonde?

Thomas is Lubuto's Library Services Advisor, and is from the town of Kitwe, Zambia. He graduated from Georgetown University with a BA in History. Thomas joined Lubuto in November 2013, and immediately became a integral part of our team. Since joining our staff, Thomas has met and formed important new partnerships with local publishers and technological innovators, revitalized library services for teens through book clubs and movie nights, and fully embodied the holistic, supportive mission of Lubuto Libraries. 

Building a Future for African Libraries

While there are many professional librarians and some library schools in Zambia, there is no coursework available in library services for children. Thomas has been accepted to the Master's in Library and Information Science program at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, giving him an opportunity to study children's library services at this prestiguous MLIS program. 

While Thomas has been offered both an assistantship and small scholarship, $25,000 is still needed to support him while he earns this essential degree. This amount includes the cost of his travel to and from Zambia, living expenses, books and academic supplies, and some remaining tuition costs. Please help contribute to this amount and play a vital role in the life of Thomas, and the lives of countless youth in Africa transformed everyday by visits to libraries made just for them. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please follow Lubuto on twitter, facebook, LinkedIn and Wordpress to learn more about our work and spread the word about our campaign!

story:
Fresno State Paintball History and Needs

  • Fresno State Paintball was founded in August 2012 in hopes of spreading the sport of tournament paintball to students on the Fresno State campus.
  • The team is in need of more supporters to help them continue to compete in the NCPA regulated events. Fresno State is one of two college teams on the West Coast, making it incredibly difficult to compete with the other colleges across the country. 
  • The team currently competes in two National events in Lakeland, Florida each year with the Collegiate World Cup in October, and the Collegiate National Championships in April. Due to the large distances that the team has to travel to Florida for each event, this strains our current budget and often makes it hard for each member to afford to play.
  • Our goal is to raise $5000 which will help the team in tournament and traveling costs for the tournaments we will be competing in the next season. If we do not raise the amount the team will be unable to continue competing on the national level and will leave our student athletes without the opportunity to increase their college experience.
  • We are a group of student athletes which means all of our players are studying grueling majors from Physical Therapy to Business to Mechanical Engineering. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • If we reach our goal of $5000 we will use it as the following:
  • $2500 will be used to help cover costs of tournament registration fees
  • $1000 will be used to help offset the cost of paintballs at tournaments which exceeds $2500 at most tournaments
  • $1500 will be used to help in travel costs to bring more of our teammates to our tournaments
  • We have a few packages available for sponsors of our campaign. The team is giving away custom made stickers, shirts, Fresno State paintball jerseys, and sponsorship banner spots.
  • If we do not achieve our goal, we will use the funds in the most critical areas to help offset the out of pocket costs of our players. 

The Impact

  • An contribution will have a significant impact on a number of college students as they try to compete on the highest level of their collegiate sport. It is rewarding to sponsor a team or organization to help achieve their dreams of winning a National Championship on the collegiate level. Our student athletes are hard working and would love to see the community stand up and help support the team and the sport of paintball. 
  • We currently have nine rostered tournament players that travel to every tournament and compete at the highest level of collegiate paintball. However, the  large distances and lack of funding has caused the players to pay out of pocket on top of college expense which is proven to be quite difficult. 
  • Contributions made by the public will make it possible for more students to compete and experience the thrill of a collegiate sport while developing leadership skills.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to make a contribution at this time we politely ask you to share our story in hopes of gaining momentum on the global level.
  • Please share using twitter, Facebook, or any social media would be greatly appreciated.

story:
Nikola Tesla / Electrotherapy Museum

My name is Jeff Behary and I am curator of the Electrotherapy Museum (www.electrotherapymuseum.com).  What started off as an eccentric antique collection of medical and scientific oddities quickly grew into a large archive of obscure knowledge regarding the origins of electrical  technologies, electricity in medicine, and rare historical pieces stemming from the researches of famed inventor Nikola Tesla.  For 18 years I've opened my home to visitors from around the world... but now I have a family and my house outgrew my collection in a hurry.

  • Our website currently gets over 7.5 million hits per year worldwide
  • If it looks ancient and makes arcs, sparks, shocks, vibrates, irradiates, lights up, cures, kills, or interferes with your neighbors TV and radios:  we have it.

You can help keep the sparks alive!

We are not trying to compete with million dollar museums.  We just need a small building to safely preserve 200 years of rare books, machines, and documents.   In most museums things are behind glass cases.  Those cases cost more than we are asking for.  In this museum, everything is out in the open.  You can pick up a priceless piece of history, or read a 200 year old book.  Turn the crank on a machine from the 1800s and see sparks...  Everything is functional and able to be demonstrated in an up-close and personal manner.  And I can talk for hours about any of it if you really want to listen...

A warehouse would be a dream come true...but honestly it can be a large air-conditioned shed.  It doesn't have to be fancy.  It just needs to protect what is really important:  the contents. 

Your donations can not only help us achieve that, we are offering replicas of some of our unique historical pieces as perks to your support.    Stuff that you can't find anywhere else.

If we don't receive all of the funds, we will still do our best with what we have.  Even if that means transporting everything to a secure storage facility.  It would be  better than risking damage to any of the pieces.  Many are the first or last machines of their kind, and some of the books are sole surviving copies.

This museum isn't my job:  it's my life.

I am trying very hard to break the mold of most museums, curators, and historians.   Many museums can't take the time to answer emails...and some aren't even familiar with the items in their own collection.  We are the opposite.  We know each and every machine as if we made them personally, and there is nothing more we enjoy than sharing that knowledge with the world.  We may be a backyard museum, but in the past few years we accomplished more than many large institutions:

Television Programs:
American Pickers (History Channel, USA)
Strangest Weather On Earth, Weather Channel (USA, UK)
Mysteries At The Museum 2, Travel Channel (USA)
Giants Of The Light And Shadow, NHK TV (Japan)
Modern Marvels “Mad Electricity”, History Channel (USA)
Somewhere Out There, Pilot Episode, Toronto (Canada)
Miracle Events Unbelievable, Fuji Film, (Japan)
Disinformation TV, (UK)

Movies / Films: 
Struck By Lightning, Wenneker TV (Netherlands) 
All About Tesla:  The Research, Maxim Films (Germany) 

Music Video:
Snowhite, Snovonne (Slovakia and Eastern Europe) 

Books:
Capacity for Murder, Bernadette Pajer, Poised Pen Press 
Reminiscences Of A Birdman, Robert Campbell, Living History Press 
Quack!  Tales of Medical Fraud, Bob McCoy, Santa Monica  

Magazines & Periodicals:
Palm Beach Senior/Boomer, Cover article (USA) 
Colors (Italy) 
Aunt Minnie Radiology News (Worldwide Web) 
Les Nouvelles Esthetiques (USA, Canada) 
Flyer Magazine (UK) 
Sail Magazine (USA) 

Published Lectures:
The Quest For Kinraide, Long Island, NY 
History of High Frequency Coils in Medicine, Philadelphia 
Real History Of Electrotherapy, Seattle, WA 
150th Anniversary of Nikola Tesla, Long Island, NY 
Redefining Tesla Technologies, Salt Lake City, UT 
Turn Of The Century Discoveries, Washington DC 

Radio Interview:
“Questions Questions”, BBC Radio (United Kingdom) 

 

Other Ways You Can Help (if money is a problem):

If I were wealthy I wouldn't be asking for donations.  I work as a machinst in South Florida, and I know work and money are not easy to get.  If you enjoy obscure history and strange science and medicine, or value the work and inventions of Nikola Tesla, perhaps you can share our story with your friends!
story_txt:
Nikola Tesla / Electrotherapy Museum My name is Jeff Behary and I am curator of the Electrotherapy Museum (www.electrotherapymuseum.com).  What started off as an eccentric antique collection of medical and scientific oddities quickly grew into a large archive of obscure knowledge regarding the origins of electrical  technologies, electricity in medicine, and rare historical pieces stemming from the researches of famed inventor Nikola Tesla.  For 18 years I've opened my home to visitors from around the world... but now I have a family and my house outgrew my collection in a hurry.

Our website currently gets over 7.5 million hits per year worldwide If it looks ancient and makes arcs, sparks, shocks, vibrates, irradiates, lights up, cures, kills, or interferes with your neighbors TV and radios:  we have it.

  You can help keep the sparks alive! We are not trying to compete with million dollar museums.  We just need a small building to safely preserve 200 years of rare books, machines, and documents.   In most museums things are behind glass cases.  Those cases cost more than we are asking for.  In this museum, everything is out in the open.  You can pick up a priceless piece of history, or read a 200 year old book.  Turn the crank on a machine from the 1800s and see sparks...  Everything is functional and able to be demonstrated in an up-close and personal manner.  And I can talk for hours about any of it if you really want to listen...A warehouse would be a dream come true...but honestly it can be a large air-conditioned shed.  It doesn't have to be fancy.  It just needs to protect what is really important:  the contents. Your donations can not only help us achieve that, we are offering replicas of some of our unique historical pieces as perks to your support.    Stuff that you can't find anywhere else.If we don't receive all of the funds, we will still do our best with what we have.  Even if that means transporting everything to a secure storage facility.  It would be  better than risking damage to any of the pieces.  Many are the first or last machines of their kind, and some of the books are sole surviving copies.

I am trying very hard to break the mold of most museums, curators, and historians.   Many museums can't take the time to answer emails...and some aren't even familiar with the items in their own collection.  We are the opposite.  We know each and every machine as if we made them personally, and there is nothing more we enjoy than sharing that knowledge with the world.  We may be a backyard museum, but in the past few years we accomplished more than many large institutions:

Movies / Films: Struck By Lightning, Wenneker TV (Netherlands) All About Tesla:  The Research, Maxim Films (Germany) 
Music Video:Snowhite, Snovonne (Slovakia and Eastern Europe) 
Books:Capacity for Murder, Bernadette Pajer, Poised Pen Press Reminiscences Of A Birdman, Robert Campbell, Living History Press Quack!  Tales of Medical Fraud, Bob McCoy, Santa Monica  
Magazines & Periodicals:Palm Beach Senior/Boomer, Cover article (USA) Colors (Italy) Aunt Minnie Radiology News (Worldwide Web) Les Nouvelles Esthetiques (USA, Canada) Flyer Magazine (UK) Sail Magazine (USA)
