story:
Hi All - this campaign is still open and we're hoping to reach the

STRETCH GOAL: $50,000. 

Thank you everyone for your support! We appreciate this very much.

_________________________________________________________________________
 

EINSTEIN spent the last 30 years of his life searching for an answer to the deepest question about the universe: does a fundamental principle, that governs all of reality, exist? He was searching for a unified field theory but he did not succeed.

In 2013 we, the theoretical physicist Jesper Møller Grimstrup and the mathematician Johannes Aastrup, discovered a simple mathematical principle, which we believe could be exactly what Einstein was searching for.

In a recent series of publications* we have shown that this principle, which we found after 10 years of research, entails a rich mathematical theory - we call it QUANTUM HOLONOMY THEORY - that shows signs of being a unified theory of quantum gravity. If our hypothesis is true it will revolutionize not only physics but science in general and beyond.

The purpose of this crowdfunding campaign is to secure the funding needed to further analyze this mathematical principle and the theory it entails and to determine if this really is a 'theory of everything'.

 

 

 

THE PRINCIPLE

The principle, which we discovered, is an algebra that essentially encodes how objects are moved in an abstract space. 

This elementary algebra simultaneously includes the fundamental premise of a quantum theory of gravity and a mathematical mechanism known to be related to a unification of the fundamental forces. This means that this algebra includes key elements of a unified theory of quantum gravity - the holy grail of modern physics.

Surprisingly, this algebra has never been studied before.

We found this algebra after many years of analysis, where we applied methods of modern mathematics to the questions of how to quantize Einsteins theory of general relativity and how to unify the four fundamental forces of Nature.

The reconciliation of quantum mechanics with Einsteins theory of relativity is the most important unsolved problem in modern theoretical physics and is believed to hold the key to some of the deepest mysteries about the universe and its origin.

 

Why is this algebra remarkable?

There are three features, which makes this algebra exceedingly interesting to study:

  • It is so elementary, that it seems immune to further reductions in the sense of being explained by other, deeper mathematical principles.
  • It gives rise to a rich mathematical structure, that links together several modern research programs in theoretical physics and mathematics.
  • It is so utterly natural.

 

 

THE THEORY

Our analysis so far shows that this algebra generates a complex mathematical theory, which we call quantum holonomy theory. This theory has a number of remarkable features:

  • It is a candidate for a quantum theory of gravity. 
  • It includes matter with the correct coupling to gravity.
  • It produces a key mathematical mechanism that is known to be related to gauge degrees of freedom, i.e. fundamental forces.
  • It shows promising signs of being internally consistent.

These achievements are very non-trivial and make quantum holonomy theory an exciting candidate for a unified theory of quantum gravity.

Our results are either published in top international journals such as Communications in Mathematical Physics and Classical and Quantum Gravity or presently in the peer review process. For more information on quantum holonomy theory please check out this homepage or these papers*.

 

THE GOAL

There are two natural milestones for this project:

  • A consistent theory. A mathematical proof that quantum holonomy theory is internally consistent. In physics-lingo this means proving that the constraint algebra closes off-shell.
  • Proof of unification. Unambiguous proof that quantum holonomy theory is a theory of unification of the fundamental forces. In physics-lingo this means a clear connection to the non-commutative formulation of the Standard Model of Particle Physics.

If just one of these goals are met it will be clear that quantum holonomy theory is one of the most promising candidate for a final theory that is known today. 

The goal of this crowdfunding campaign is to meet at least one of these milestones. We believe that this is possible within five years.

 

 

 

Why is this research important?

With quantum holonomy theory we propose a completely new approach to one of the greatest scientific problems ever. We have already shown that the theory is a serious candidate for a final theory. We believe that it is imperative to further analyze this framework. 

A final theory is expected to provide answers to some of the deepest questions in modern physics: 

  •  What happened at t=0 at the big bang? 
  •  What is dark matter and dark energy? 
  •  What happens at the singularity of a black hole? 
  •  Are the laws of physics unique? 
  •  Will the universe expand forever?

Curiosity is part of what makes us human. Science is about the big questions, the fundamental "Why?" that seizes us when we gaze into the night sky. This is an integral part of our cultural DNA.

We believe very deeply in our research and in the aspiration towards a final theory. We have given everything we've got to get this far.

 

ABOUT US

 

 

Jesper Møller Grimstrup: I am a 44-year old danish theoretical physicist. I was educated at universities in Aarhus and Copenhagen in Denmark, the ETH Zürich in Switzerland and at the Technical University of Vienna, Austria, where I received my Ph.D. I am an expert in theoretical high-energy physics, quantum gravity and non-commutative geometry.

I held a research position in theoretical physics at the Niels Bohr Institute in Copenhagen until 2011, when I was no longer able to obtain funding for my research. Since then I have financed my research with savings.

 

 

Johannes Aastrup: I am an assistant professor in mathematics at the Leibniz University of Hannover, Germany. I was born in 1974 in Denmark and was educated at the University of Copenhagen, Denmark, where I received my Ph.D. in 2002. I am an expert in geometric analysis, non-commutative geometry, operator algebras and mathematical physics.

For further information we refer to our home-pages, where our CV’s and publications are available.

 

 

ENDORSEMENTS

 

 

 

 

                                 - Professor Lee Smolin, Perimeter Institute, Canada                                                                           author of The Trouble With Physics

 

 

                                                       - Professor Matilde Marcolli, Caltech, US

 

 


                                                       - Professor Adam Rennie, MSI, Australia

 

 

              - Professor Raimar Wulkenhaar, Münster University, Germany
 

 

 

 

 

 

THE REWARDS

Essentially, what we have to offer is our research and we now invite you to play a role and take part in our adventure. We promise to do our very best! We have the following rewards for our backers:

  • A popular book about our research. As our project develops Jesper will dedicate time to write a book for a general audience about our work. Jesper: "This book will be about the why and whereto's, about the big questions and the big picture. I will explain how we came upon the ideas that lead us to quantum holonomy theory - a story that starts in the the militarized zone of Aksai Chin in the Tibetan Himalayas and involves both Kafka, Camus and the sci-fi movie Dark City; I will write about the background: Einsteins theory of general relativity and quantum mechanics and why most physicists believe that a theory, which combine these two, must exist; and I will write about quantum holonomy theory itself, the basic ideas and their implications. I will also write about what impact I believe the possible discovery of a final theory will have on society and on our perception of the world. Above all I will write about our fascination and love for our work. This book will be our main reward to our backers, either as an e-book or a proper book".
  • Official acknowledgement. It is customary to acknowledge financial support in scientific publications. We pledge to acknowledge in detail the largest donations in our future publications. Thus, if you choose this option your name will appear in some of the top international scientific journals - listed in the acknowledgement section of our papers or on the front page. 
  • A newsletter. Everyone who supports us will receive a newsletter with updates on our research, new publications and general trends in modern physics. 

 

Why crowdfunding?

This project has been a long time in the making. We spent more than a decade of research until we found what we were searching for. It is difficult to sustain funding for such a long period for a research project, that is far away from mainstream physics.

Our research has taken us into completely unchartered territory. We combine two very different and highly specialized research directions - non-commutative geometry and canonical quantum gravity -, neither of which are mainstream. It takes time for a new research direction to reach the level of impact required to secure a steady flow of funding. 

This leaves us in the unusual situation where we have obtained strong results while at the same time are running out of money. Unless we get external funding we will not be able to continue our work. This is the reason why we now ask the crowdfunding community for support. 

If you would like to have additional information about our previous and present funding situation you are welcome to contact us. You can also find more information on our home-pages.

How we will spend the money

The funding raised in this campaign will primarily be used to finance research time for Jesper Møller Grimstrup. In plain english this means salary. To make the funding last as long as possible Jesper will make do with a very modest salary.

Stretch goals

The more money we raise the more time we will have for research. We are deeply grateful for any support. We here formulate two additional stretch goals:

  • If a miracle happens and we manage to raise 200.000 $ we will buy Johannes Aastrup extra research time. 
  • If two miracles happen and we raise 400.000 $ we will hire additional researchers to join us.

 

More about the PHYSICS

 

Let us finally provide a little more information on quantum holonomy theory. This part will involve a certain level of technicality.

 

The foundation

The algebra, which we call the Quantum Holonomy-Diffeomorphism (QHD) algebra, is build of two types of elements: 

 

  • so-called holonomy-diffeomorphisms on a 3-dimensional space. A holonomy-diffeomorphisms is the mathematical entity, that moves stuff in space. 
  • certain translation operators that shift the way the holonomy-diffeomorphisms operate.

 

The first thing to note about the QHD algebra is that an infinitesimal version of its central algebraic relation is identical to what is called the canonical commutation relation of canonical quantum gravity formulated with Ashtekar variables. This means that a theory build over the QHD algebra automatically involves the kinematics of quantum gravity, i.e. the basic requirement for a quantization of Einsteins theory general relativity. 

 

Furthermore, the QHD algebra is non-commutative, which means that it naturally falls within the framework of non-commutative geometry, a branch of modern mathematics, which has proven to be highly relevant for the question of how to unify the four fundamental forces of Nature. In our work we have shown that the QHD algebra in a semi-classical limit produces a so-called almost-commutative algebra, which is the key ingredient in a unification scheme due to Alain Connes and Ali Chamseddine. In that formulation the emergence of gauge and Higgs sectors - i.e. fundamental forces and masses - can be traced back to this almost-commutative algebra.

 

All together this means that the QHD algebra has a mathematical structure that makes it extremely interesting to study in the context of a unified theory of quantum gravity. It naturally combines the two most important ingredients for a fundamental theory.

 

 

Building the theory 

Once we have the QHD algebra we need to build a theory around it. The first ingredient we require is a Hilbert space, which is the mathematical stage on which the algebra acts in order to produce the numbers, which may eventually be measured in experiments.

 

To do this we first find a quantum state on the QHD algebra  -  this is the prerequisite for a Hilbert space. Once we have a single quantum state on the algebra we can use what is known as the GNS construction to build a Hilbert space. 

 

Once we have a Hilbert space we have essentially a quantum theory.

 

Incidentally, the states we find are semi-classical. This means that this theory already has a well-defined semi-classical approximation, an issue that is a serious challenge within other non-perturbative approaches to quantum theory of gravity.

 

Furthermore, it is an important result that the semi-classical limit of an operator, which resembles a curvature operator, produces the Hamiltonian of general relativity formulated in terms of Ashtekar variables. This means that Einsteins theory of general relativity emerges from this operator. 

 

In addition to all this we also find states in the kinematical Hilbert space, which produces what is known as the Dirac Hamiltonian in the semi-classical limit. This means that the theory also includes matter with the correct gravitational coupling.

 

With this brief tour we have a rough outline of quantum holonomy theory. We hope that it will be clear that the QHD algebra is worthy of further analysis. For more information please go to this homepage or contact us.

 

Further information

  • Homepage Jesper Grimstrup 
  • Homepage Johannes Aastrup
  • Publications: Jesper Grimstrup
  • Publications: Johannes Aastrup
  • Researchgate: Jesper Grimstrup
  • Public ORCID account (Jesper Grimstrup)
  • Academia.edu (Jesper Grimstrup)
  • LinkedIn profile (Jesper Grimstrup)
  • In the news (in danish)

 

                      

    Risks & Challenges

    In fundamental research there are no guarantees of success. Often things turn out different than anticipated and sometimes new directions of  research open op where old ideas failed. And there is always the possibility that you are working yourself down the wrong alley. This is what fundamental research is like. If we knew beforehand we would not need to look.

    In the course of our own research careers we have encountered numerous setbacks. Every time this happens we pause, think, and push on. Like all researcher do.

    We are however confident that no-matter what happens this project will generate a steady flow of scientific output.

    If we obtain additional research funding during the timespan of this crowdfunding campaign we shall save the received money for later scientific use.

    ________________________________________________________________________

    * the publications mentioned above are either already published or in the peer review process.

STRETCH GOAL: $50,000. 
Thank you everyone for your support! We appreciate this very much.
_________________________________________________________________________
 
EINSTEIN spent the last 30 years of his life searching for an answer to the deepest question about the universe: does a fundamental principle, that governs all of reality, exist? He was searching for a unified field theory but he did not succeed.
In 2013 we, the theoretical physicist Jesper Møller Grimstrup and the mathematician Johannes Aastrup, discovered a simple mathematical principle, which we believe could be exactly what Einstein was searching for.
In a recent series of publications* we have shown that this principle, which we found after 10 years of research, entails a rich mathematical theory - we call it QUANTUM HOLONOMY THEORY - that shows signs of being a unified theory of quantum gravity. If our hypothesis is true it will revolutionize not only physics but science in general and beyond.
The purpose of this crowdfunding campaign is to secure the funding needed to further analyze this mathematical principle and the theory it entails and to determine if this really is a 'theory of everything'.
 
 

 
THE PRINCIPLE
The principle, which we discovered, is an algebra that essentially encodes how objects are moved in an abstract space. 
This elementary algebra simultaneously includes the fundamental premise of a quantum theory of gravity and a mathematical mechanism known to be related to a unification of the fundamental forces. This means that this algebra includes key elements of a unified theory of quantum gravity - the holy grail of modern physics.
Surprisingly, this algebra has never been studied before.
We found this algebra after many years of analysis, where we applied methods of modern mathematics to the questions of how to quantize Einsteins theory of general relativity and how to unify the four fundamental forces of Nature.
The reconciliation of quantum mechanics with Einsteins theory of relativity is the most important unsolved problem in modern theoretical physics and is believed to hold the key to some of the deepest mysteries about the universe and its origin.
 
Why is this algebra remarkable?
There are three features, which makes this algebra exceedingly interesting to study:

It is so elementary, that it seems immune to further reductions in the sense of being explained by other, deeper mathematical principles.
It gives rise to a rich mathematical structure, that links together several modern research programs in theoretical physics and mathematics.
It is so utterly natural.


 
 
THE THEORY
Our analysis so far shows that this algebra generates a complex mathematical theory, which we call quantum holonomy theory. This theory has a number of remarkable features:

It is a candidate for a quantum theory of gravity. 
It includes matter with the correct coupling to gravity.
It produces a key mathematical mechanism that is known to be related to gauge degrees of freedom, i.e. fundamental forces.
It shows promising signs of being internally consistent.

These achievements are very non-trivial and make quantum holonomy theory an exciting candidate for a unified theory of quantum gravity.
Our results are either published in top international journals such as Communications in Mathematical Physics and Classical and Quantum Gravity or presently in the peer review process. For more information on quantum holonomy theory please check out this homepage or these papers*.
 
THE GOAL
There are two natural milestones for this project:


A consistent theory. A mathematical proof that quantum holonomy theory is internally consistent. In physics-lingo this means proving that the constraint algebra closes off-shell.

Proof of unification. Unambiguous proof that quantum holonomy theory is a theory of unification of the fundamental forces. In physics-lingo this means a clear connection to the non-commutative formulation of the Standard Model of Particle Physics.

If just one of these goals are met it will be clear that quantum holonomy theory is one of the most promising candidate for a final theory that is known today. 
The goal of this crowdfunding campaign is to meet at least one of these milestones. We believe that this is possible within five years.
 

 
 
Why is this research important?
With quantum holonomy theory we propose a completely new approach to one of the greatest scientific problems ever. We have already shown that the theory is a serious candidate for a final theory. We believe that it is imperative to further analyze this framework. 
A final theory is expected to provide answers to some of the deepest questions in modern physics: 


 What happened at t=0 at the big bang? 


 What is dark matter and dark energy? 


 What happens at the singularity of a black hole? 


 Are the laws of physics unique? 


 Will the universe expand forever?


Curiosity is part of what makes us human. Science is about the big questions, the fundamental "Why?" that seizes us when we gaze into the night sky. This is an integral part of our cultural DNA.
We believe very deeply in our research and in the aspiration towards a final theory. We have given everything we've got to get this far.
 
ABOUT US

 
 



Jesper Møller Grimstrup: I am a 44-year old danish theoretical physicist. I was educated at universities in Aarhus and Copenhagen in Denmark, the ETH Zürich in Switzerland and at the Technical University of Vienna, Austria, where I received my Ph.D. I am an expert in theoretical high-energy physics, quantum gravity and non-commutative geometry.
I held a research position in theoretical physics at the Niels Bohr Institute in Copenhagen until 2011, when I was no longer able to obtain funding for my research. Since then I have financed my research with savings.


 
 


Johannes Aastrup: I am an assistant professor in mathematics at the Leibniz University of Hannover, Germany. I was born in 1974 in Denmark and was educated at the University of Copenhagen, Denmark, where I received my Ph.D. in 2002. I am an expert in geometric analysis, non-commutative geometry, operator algebras and mathematical physics.
For further information we refer to our home-pages, where our CV’s and publications are available.
 
 ENDORSEMENTS
 
 
 
 
                                 - Professor Lee Smolin, Perimeter Institute, Canada                                                                           author of The Trouble With Physics 
 
                                                       - Professor Matilde Marcolli, Caltech, US 
 

                                                       - Professor Adam Rennie, MSI, Australia
 
 
              - Professor Raimar Wulkenhaar, Münster University, Germany   
 
 
 
 THE REWARDS
Essentially, what we have to offer is our research and we now invite you to play a role and take part in our adventure. We promise to do our very best! We have the following rewards for our backers:

A popular book about our research. As our project develops Jesper will dedicate time to write a book for a general audience about our work. Jesper: "This book will be about the why and whereto's, about the big questions and the big picture. I will explain how we came upon the ideas that lead us to quantum holonomy theory - a story that starts in the the militarized zone of Aksai Chin in the Tibetan Himalayas and involves both Kafka, Camus and the sci-fi movie Dark City; I will write about the background: Einsteins theory of general relativity and quantum mechanics and why most physicists believe that a theory, which combine these two, must exist; and I will write about quantum holonomy theory itself, the basic ideas and their implications. I will also write about what impact I believe the possible discovery of a final theory will have on society and on our perception of the world. Above all I will write about our fascination and love for our work. This book will be our main reward to our backers, either as an e-book or a proper book".


Official acknowledgement. It is customary to acknowledge financial support in scientific publications. We pledge to acknowledge in detail the largest donations in our future publications. Thus, if you choose this option your name will appear in some of the top international scientific journals - listed in the acknowledgement section of our papers or on the front page. 

A newsletter. Everyone who supports us will receive a newsletter with updates on our research, new publications and general trends in modern physics. 
 
Why crowdfunding?
This project has been a long time in the making. We spent more than a decade of research until we found what we were searching for. It is difficult to sustain funding for such a long period for a research project, that is far away from mainstream physics.
Our research has taken us into completely unchartered territory. We combine two very different and highly specialized research directions - non-commutative geometry and canonical quantum gravity -, neither of which are mainstream. It takes time for a new research direction to reach the level of impact required to secure a steady flow of funding. 
This leaves us in the unusual situation where we have obtained strong results while at the same time are running out of money. Unless we get external funding we will not be able to continue our work. This is the reason why we now ask the crowdfunding community for support. 
If you would like to have additional information about our previous and present funding situation you are welcome to contact us. You can also find more information on our home-pages.
How we will spend the money
The funding raised in this campaign will primarily be used to finance research time for Jesper Møller Grimstrup. In plain english this means salary. To make the funding last as long as possible Jesper will make do with a very modest salary.
Stretch goals
The more money we raise the more time we will have for research. We are deeply grateful for any support. We here formulate two additional stretch goals:

If a miracle happens and we manage to raise 200.000 $ we will buy Johannes Aastrup extra research time. 
If two miracles happen and we raise 400.000 $ we will hire additional researchers to join us.


 
More about the PHYSICS
 
Let us finally provide a little more information on quantum holonomy theory. This part will involve a certain level of technicality.
 
The foundation
The algebra, which we call the Quantum Holonomy-Diffeomorphism (QHD) algebra, is build of two types of elements: 
 
so-called holonomy-diffeomorphisms on a 3-dimensional space. A holonomy-diffeomorphisms is the mathematical entity, that moves stuff in space. 
certain translation operators that shift the way the holonomy-diffeomorphisms operate.
 
The first thing to note about the QHD algebra is that an infinitesimal version of its central algebraic relation is identical to what is called the canonical commutation relation of canonical quantum gravity formulated with Ashtekar variables. This means that a theory build over the QHD algebra automatically involves the kinematics of quantum gravity, i.e. the basic requirement for a quantization of Einsteins theory general relativity. 
 
Furthermore, the QHD algebra is non-commutative, which means that it naturally falls within the framework of non-commutative geometry, a branch of modern mathematics, which has proven to be highly relevant for the question of how to unify the four fundamental forces of Nature. In our work we have shown that the QHD algebra in a semi-classical limit produces a so-called almost-commutative algebra, which is the key ingredient in a unification scheme due to Alain Connes and Ali Chamseddine. In that formulation the emergence of gauge and Higgs sectors - i.e. fundamental forces and masses - can be traced back to this almost-commutative algebra.
 
All together this means that the QHD algebra has a mathematical structure that makes it extremely interesting to study in the context of a unified theory of quantum gravity. It naturally combines the two most important ingredients for a fundamental theory.
 
 

Building the theory 
Once we have the QHD algebra we need to build a theory around it. The first ingredient we require is a Hilbert space, which is the mathematical stage on which the algebra acts in order to produce the numbers, which may eventually be measured in experiments.
 
To do this we first find a quantum state on the QHD algebra  -  this is the prerequisite for a Hilbert space. Once we have a single quantum state on the algebra we can use what is known as the GNS construction to build a Hilbert space. 
 
Once we have a Hilbert space we have essentially a quantum theory.
 
Incidentally, the states we find are semi-classical. This means that this theory already has a well-defined semi-classical approximation, an issue that is a serious challenge within other non-perturbative approaches to quantum theory of gravity.
 
Furthermore, it is an important result that the semi-classical limit of an operator, which resembles a curvature operator, produces the Hamiltonian of general relativity formulated in terms of Ashtekar variables. This means that Einsteins theory of general relativity emerges from this operator. 
 
In addition to all this we also find states in the kinematical Hilbert space, which produces what is known as the Dirac Hamiltonian in the semi-classical limit. This means that the theory also includes matter with the correct gravitational coupling.
 
With this brief tour we have a rough outline of quantum holonomy theory. We hope that it will be clear that the QHD algebra is worthy of further analysis. For more information please go to this homepage or contact us.
 
Further information

Homepage Jesper Grimstrup 
Homepage Johannes Aastrup

Publications: Jesper Grimstrup

Publications: Johannes Aastrup

Researchgate: Jesper Grimstrup


Public ORCID account (Jesper Grimstrup)

Academia.edu (Jesper Grimstrup)

LinkedIn profile (Jesper Grimstrup)

In the news (in danish)


 
                      

Risks & Challenges

In fundamental research there are no guarantees of success. Often things turn out different than anticipated and sometimes new directions of  research open op where old ideas failed. And there is always the possibility that you are working yourself down the wrong alley. This is what fundamental research is like. If we knew beforehand we would not need to look.
In the course of our own research careers we have encountered numerous setbacks. Every time this happens we pause, think, and push on. Like all researcher do.
We are however confident that no-matter what happens this project will generate a steady flow of scientific output.
If we obtain additional research funding during the timespan of this crowdfunding campaign we shall save the received money for later scientific use.
________________________________________________________________________
* the publications mentioned above are either already published or in the peer review process.

story:
MAMME IN BICI è una scuola di bicicletta per le donne di tutte le età e paesi nata a Milano: aiutaci ad andare avanti, anche in altre città!

BIKE MOMS is a bicycle class for women of all ages and countries settled in Milan, Italy: help us to keep going, also in other cities!


Il Progetto

Mamme in Bici è un corso di bicicletta gratuito rivolto a donne che non hanno mai avuto l’opportunità di imparare a pedalare. Siamo arrivati a 18 iscritte: Rania, Simona, Reem, Demiana, Carla e altre mamme e donne che provengono in gran parte da paesi in cui l’uso femminile della bicicletta è proibito, malvisto o comunque non incoraggiato, retaggio di una visione che ritiene più consono limitare la mobilità della donna, il suo accesso alle pratiche sportive e l’adozione di indumenti di fattura occidentale. Mamme in Bici accoglie la volontà di andare in bicicletta da parte delle donne in un’ottica di una maggiore indipendenza, integrazione sociale e culturale, autostima. Vogliamo, soprattutto, che dopo il corso le donne continuino a usare la bicicletta come mezzo di trasporto individuale, come simbolo di libertà e di indipendenza, come motivo di benessere e salute, per sé e per gli altri. Abbiamo bisogno di fondi per chiudere quest'anno e garantire il prossimo.

The Project

Bike Moms is a no-profit bicycle class for women who have never had the opportunity to learn to ride. 18 have enrolled so far: Rania, Simona, Reem, Demiana, Carla and other moms and women who come largely from countries where women's cycling is prohibited, disliked or not encouraged, allowing to restrict the mobility of women, their access to sports and the adoption of Western style outfit. Bike Moms encourages the mom's will to learn to ride a bicycle with a view to greater independence, social and cultural integration and self-esteem. We want, above all, that they will continue to use the bicycle as a mean of personal transportation, as a symbol of freedom and independence, as a reason for well-being and health for themselves and for the others. We need funds to close this year's budget and ensure the next one.


Il Corso

ll corso prevede sia incontri teorici che, ovviamente, la pratica. Come teoria, oltre alle norme di sicurezza, alle dotazioni di legge e al Codice della Strada, abbiamo raccontato come la bicicletta sia diventata, tra la fine dell'800 e il principio del '900, il simbolo dell'emancipazione e dell'indipendenza femminile sia in Europa e in America, cambiando perfino il modo di vestire! Le allieve ricevono poi le nozioni base di ciclomeccanica e di uso e manutenzione dei diversi accessori, come le luci e gli antifurti. Al termine del programma, saranno anche analizzati i loro percorsi quotidiani e il loro comportamento in strada. Le allieve cicliste, una volta imparato ad andare in bici, apriranno il corteo del CycloPride Day Milano 2016 (15 maggio 2016), una manifestazione che nelle passate edizioni ha visto oltre 30.000 partecipanti. 

The bike class

The bike class includes lessons as well as practice. In addition to safety standards and law prescriptions, we tell moms how the bicycle has become, between the XIXth and the principle of XXth Centuries, the symbol of women's emancipation and independence both in Europe and America, even changing the way they used to dress! The Moms also receive the bike maintenance and tech basics. At the end of the program, they will also be analyzed their daily routes and their behavior in the street. Once they've learned to ride a bike, they will open the bike parade of Milan's CycloPride Day 2016 (May 15th, 2016), an event that in the past years has seen more than 30,000 participants.


Il Crowdfunding

Siamo convinti che le attività di promozione sociale siano realmente efficaci quando dimostrino di produrre ricchezza. I vostri soldi ci servono per consolidare la struttura e l'operatività del corso, ma anche per dare gioia e indipendenza ad altre donne, facendo sì che questo progetto possa essere replicato sia a Milano che in altre città. Per le allieve il corso è completamente gratuito. Al termine riceveranno una bicicletta e la relativa attrezzatura in regalo. Per noi che ci lavoriamo (siamo almeno in 10 ogni lezione, una volta alla settimana, per 6 mesi) è impegno volontario, ma crediamo che debba essere, almeno in parte, retribuito. 

Bike Mums Crowdfunding

We are convinced that social promotion activities are really effective when demonstrating to produce wealth. We need your money to enforce structure and operation of the project, but also to give joy and independence to other women, by ensuring that this project can be replicated in Milan and in other italian cities. The bike class is totally free to moms. At the end they will receive a bicycle and related equipment as a gift. For us who work there (we are at least 10 per lesson, once a week, for 6 months) is a voluntary commitment, but we believe it should be, at least in part, paid.




Il Budget

Ci servono almeno 10.000,00 Euro. A cosa servono? Non lo stiamo già facendo? Sì, ma lo stiamo facendo gratis, e un progetto così complesso non può proseguire su una base completamente volontaria. Ci sono già alcune aziende che stanno sostenendo il progetto, donandoci materiale d'uso per il corso, come le prime 10 biciclette, e le ricompense legate alle vostre donazioni, come selle in edizione limitata, esclusive borse da viaggio e altro. Ma se non arriveranno dei soldi, tutto questo si fermerà. Non ci sarà un prossimo anno, come è successo in analoghe esperienze. Adesso, i soldi ci servono per pagare un minimo di rimborso spese a chi ci sta aiutando sia con le lezioni di teoria e pratica che con la comunicazione e l'impegno di progettazione e gestione del progetto. Inoltre vorremmo acquistare accessori necessari all'uso quotidiano della bicicletta, come delle rastrelliere robuste, da installare nelle abitazioni delle allieve, in modo da ridurre il rischio di furto e poter continuare a seguire le allieve degli anni precedenti. Infine, per preparare l'espansione del progetto in un'altra città, vogliamo retribuire chi si potrà occupare della ricerca e della progettazione necessaria all'adattamento del corso a un'altro territorio.

Budget

We need at least 10,000.00 Euros. Why? Are we not already doing it? Yes, but we are doing it for free, and we can't afford to manage such a complex project only on a voluntary basis. Some companies are already supporting the project, giving us material of use for the class for free, such as the first 10 bicycles, and the perks related to your donations, such as limited edition saddles, exclusive travel bags, and more. But unless we get some money, all this will stop in a flash. There will be not a next year. We need money to pay a minimum of reimbursement to those who are teaching both theory and practice, or helping to design communication or doing the everyday managing of the project. We would also like to buy some more accessories like robust bike racks, to be installed in the women's courtyards, in order to reduce theft risk. Finally, in preparation for the follow-up in at least one more city, we want to pay those who will develop the necessary adaptation of the project to another territory.

I nostri sostenitori 

Abbiamo la fortuna di aver ricevuto, oltre al Patrocinio del Comune di Milano (non oneroso), anche la partnership di diversi soggetti impegnati nella promozione sociale, nella formazione e nella ricerca. Noi di CycloPride Italia APS abbiamo progettato e strutturato il corso, e coordiniamo le attività; Mamme a Scuola Onlus ha raccolto le adesioni delle allieve e presta la sua capacità di mediazione culturale; L'Istituto Comprensivo “L. Cadorna” di Milano ospita nei suoi locali le attività di corso; il Politecnico di Milano, con il suo Dipartimento di Architettura e Studi Urbani (DAStU – Mapping S. Siro) sostiene a sua volta il progetto sui temi di analisi territoriale e della mobilità. Infine la troupe di Voglio una Ruota (Gamera Film, Milano), un documentario che racconta come la bicicletta ha cambiato il femminile e viceversa, segue dall'inizio Mamme in Bici per far sì che questa storia non smetta di essere raccontata. Lombardo Bikes, tra i maggiori produttori italiani di biciclette, ha donato le prime dieci bici per il corso; come ricompense alle vostre donazioni, Selle Royal, il gruppo leader mondiale nelle selle da bici una serie limitata dei suoi prodotti dedicata alla parità di genere; da Girolibero, leader europeo nei viaggi in bici, arrivano dieci borse da viaggio e una city bike unisex. Adesso tocca a voi!

Bike Mums Sponsors

We are honored to have received, in addition to the sponsorship of the City of Milan (no funds, anyway), also the partnership of different actors involved in social promotion, education and research. We from CycloPride Italia APS have designed and structured the course, and coordinate the activities; Mamme a Scuola Onlus, a charity that teaches italian language to immigrant women, has recruited the students, and lends his cultural mediation skills; Milan's public school Istituto Comprensivo "L. Cadorna" hosts in its building all the activities; Politecnico di Milano, with its Department of Architecture and Urban Studies (DAStU - Mapping S. Siro) supports the project on territorial and mobility issues. Voglio una Ruota video crew (Gamera Film, Milano), a documentary film that tells how the bicycle has changed the feminine and vice versa, ensure that this story does not stop being told. Lombardo Bikes, italian top bike maker, donated the first ten bicycles to be used by our moms; Selle Royal, world's leading company in bike saddles gave us a limited edition of their products dedicated to gender equality; and from Girolibero, Europe's top bike tour operator, ten touring panniers and a unisex city bike are coming as perks. Now, it's up to you!


Rassegna stampa essenziale / Selected press review

We
need at least 10,000.00 Euros. Why? Are we not already doing it? Yes,
but we are doing it for free, and we can't afford to manage such a complex project only on a voluntary basis. Some companies are already supporting
the project, giving us material of use for the class for free, such as the first 10 bicycles, and the perks related to your donations, such as limited edition saddles, exclusive travel bags, and more. But unless we get
some money, all this will stop in a flash. There will be not a next year. We need money to pay a
minimum of reimbursement to those who are teaching both theory and
practice, or helping to design communication or doing the everyday
managing of the project. We would also like to buy some more
accessories like robust bike racks, to be installed in the women's
courtyards, in order to reduce theft risk. Finally, in preparation
for the follow-up in at least one more city, we want to pay those who
will develop the necessary adaptation of the project to another
territory.
I nostri sostenitori 
 


Abbiamo la fortuna di aver ricevuto, oltre al
Patrocinio del Comune di Milano (non oneroso), anche la partnership di diversi
soggetti impegnati nella promozione sociale, nella formazione e nella
ricerca. Noi di CycloPride Italia APS abbiamo progettato e strutturato il corso,
e coordiniamo le attività; Mamme a Scuola Onlus ha raccolto le adesioni
delle allieve e presta la sua capacità di mediazione culturale;
L'Istituto Comprensivo “L. Cadorna” di Milano ospita nei suoi
locali le attività di corso; il Politecnico di Milano, con il suo
Dipartimento di Architettura e Studi Urbani (DAStU – Mapping S. Siro) sostiene a sua volta il progetto sui temi di analisi
territoriale e della mobilità. Infine la troupe di Voglio una Ruota
(Gamera Film, Milano), un documentario che racconta come la
bicicletta ha cambiato il femminile e viceversa, segue dall'inizio
Mamme in Bici per far sì che questa storia non smetta di essere
raccontata. Lombardo Bikes, tra i maggiori produttori italiani di biciclette, ha donato le prime dieci bici per il corso; come ricompense alle vostre donazioni, Selle Royal, il gruppo leader mondiale nelle selle da bici una serie limitata dei suoi prodotti dedicata alla parità di genere; da Girolibero, leader europeo nei viaggi in bici, arrivano dieci borse da viaggio e una city bike unisex. Adesso tocca a voi!


Bike Mums Sponsors 



We
are honored to have received, in addition to the sponsorship of the
City of Milan (no funds, anyway), also the partnership of different actors involved in
social promotion, education and research. We from CycloPride Italia APS have designed and structured the course, and coordinate the activities;
Mamme a Scuola Onlus, a charity that teaches italian language to
immigrant women, has recruited the students, and lends his cultural
mediation skills; Milan's public school Istituto Comprensivo "L. Cadorna" hosts in its building all the activities; Politecnico di Milano, with its Department of Architecture and Urban Studies
(DAStU - Mapping S. Siro) supports the project on territorial
and mobility issues. Voglio una Ruota video crew (Gamera Film,
Milano), a documentary film that tells how the bicycle has changed the
feminine and vice versa, ensure that this story does not stop being
told. Lombardo Bikes, italian top bike maker, donated the first ten bicycles to
be used by our moms; Selle Royal, world's leading company in bike
saddles gave us a limited edition of their products dedicated to gender equality; and from Girolibero, Europe's top bike tour operator, ten touring panniers and
a unisex city bike are coming as perks. Now, it's up to you!

Rassegna stampa essenziale / Selected press review

story:
What is the Crafty Workshop Project?

The Crafty workshop project are people from all over the world who share a interest in recycling, self sustainability, food security, free energy and the sharing of knowledge.

The crafty workshop project began in March 2015 as a website to share tips on recycling, up cycling and re-purposing what most people would throw away, and turn them into handy household items or gifts. In order to get the website more traffic a Facebook group was started in the hope that a few more people would get involved and from there the Crafty workshop project became what it is today.

Now almost 9 months later and the crafty workshop project has well over a thousand members from across the globe, all sharing tips and tricks on all manner of recycling, self sustainability and gardening projects.

With support and interest from many other groups and organizations including charity and established organizations, many have come to respect the crafty workshop project and its work. The belief in sharing knowledge and that knowledge should be free is still strong and dozens of ebooks can be downloaded free off our website, on subjects such as keeping chickens, free energy and building a home, with many more.

Recently a new Facebook group emerged for children, Crafty project 4 kidz was created to help children and encourage them to become more active in the garden, and for children to become more nature and wildlife aware. The group has now surpassed the original group in members and is growing bigger everyday.

If you would like to apply to us for a copy or copies of the Game for your school, Community group or club please contact us via our website and click on applications on the home page menu.

Apply - https://craftyworkshop.org/visiting-the-crafty-project/

Contact us - https://craftyworkshop.org/contact/

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/groups/CraftyProject4Kidz/

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/groups/craftyworkshop/

Website - http://craftyworkshop.org

Twitter - @workshopcrafty

Sponsored by 

http://www.permaculture.co.uk/

Why this campaign.

The crafty workshop strongly believe that in order for our future generations to have food security and a green world to grow produce we need to start teaching the younger generations knowledge of where food comes from, what part nature and wildlife plays in our lives and with our food production and how the climate and seasons are important to our future on this planet.

Recycling, keeping down our carbon footprints and shopping locally all help, but if this knowledge is not passed down to the next generation then its all for nothing.

Many children around the world have no access to a garden or have even seen a farm animal, the connection between the food in a supermarket and where it comes from is none existent for many children.

We believe that children learn through play best, and at the early ages children not only learn the most about the world but also the blueprint for who they will become as adults is formed, so with that in mind the crafty workshop project with help from Feral Games, an independent tabletop games company, got together and created the How Does Your GardenGrow Board game and they found a great, young local artist and started planning how the game would work. The game needed to be fun and informative, and also much more then just a game.


The Game and what we have planned.

The game was created and looks amazing, Holly Bushnell did an excellent job illustrating the boards, tiles and playing cards and the game is fun and informative, but now the game was made what next?

In keeping with the crafty workshop belief that all knowledge is free we decided we would give the game away for free to those children's community groups, schools and nature clubs that applied for it so that where ever they were in the world, children would have the opportunity to at least learn about nature and hopefully be encouraged to go outside and explore, start a vegetable patch or get involved with animal sanctuaries.

We have had a great response and support from many charities and they have decided to show this by backing and sharing this campaign and have offered some great perks for all of those that pledge their support.

Where you come in

In order for us to produce the game and post it to these schools, communities and groups we need your help. By pledging what you can, we will be able to get the game made and sent globally and also as an added incentive we will give a percentage of every pledge to our chosen charities mentioned below. So not only are you helping children connect with their world in various ways but you will also be helping wildlife and Bee charities that do some great work.

And also by pledging you can receive some great Perks from mugs and T shirts, to Memberships and original Art and on to copies of the game and a signed thank you Letter from Dr Brian May founder of the Save Me Trust and Guitarist with the rock band Queen.

The Hedgehog game.


As an extra incentive we have also developed Racing Hedgehogs a board game where you need to get your Hedgehog home whilst avoiding the obstacles and dangers that hedgehogs face everyday. The game was inspired by Brian May's interview as he held Percy the Hedgehog which was rescued after being kicked and beaten by a group of thugs. Unfortunately Percy was left brain damaged, but he now lives with rock royalty in the sanctuary of Brian's garden.


The Hedgehog game is only available through this campaign and afterwards the Craft workshop Project is donating it to the Save Me Trust. The games artwork is once again done by Holly Bushnell and designed by Feral Games.

And you will also be Helping.

We have chosen some great charities to support and they have been awesome in supporting this Campaign. Every time you pledge to us a percentage of that pledge gets shared amongst the charities we have adopted.

Save Me is a charity that speaks out about the cruel minority in our society that feel it is their right to persecute and torture wildlife for sport. Save Me arrived on the scene during the run up to the 2010 elections.

It was evident that if the Conservatives became elected then they would try to bring back fox hunting by repealing the act. It was an issue firmly in their manifesto. The Conservative government didn't get an outright majority and a new coalition government was formed.

The badger cull was introduced by the coalition in spite of all credible science stating that it would not work. They cancelled five of the six vaccination projects that were underway and regretted that later. In an EFRA select committee meeting on BTB, they recognised it as a "missed opportunity". 

The coalition forged ahead with the cull. We have seen two years of culling in two pilot zones confirming that it is ineffective, unsustainable and inhumane. It is one of our key issues.  The repeal was not as simple as the party had hoped for, was not sought during their time in office (2010-2015), and was prevented by others within the coalition.

http://savemetrust.org/


Mission Statement 

We are committed to encouraging through knowledge the integration of wildlife into our countryside and our gardens alongside us in a natural balance. We help to preserve wildlife in its natural environment by talking in schools and reaching the next generation and via worksheets, direct animal contact and talks.

We encourage children and adults to care for their environment and reduce the use of pesticides. We help to remove the myths that surround our spectacular wildlife and encourage the next generation to learn and understand that any space can be balanced and can be a great environment for both humans and our native wildlife.

http://www.harperaspreywildliferescue.co.uk

Wallasey HedgeHog Rescue is ran by a small group of volunteers who from their garden shed rescue injured HedgeHogs. They rely totally on donations and people offering their help.

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Hedgehog-Rescue-Wallasey/350547624957321



The Bee Girl mission is to inspire and empower communities to conserve bees and their habitat. Bee Girl, a nonprofit organization founded by Sarah Red-Laird, aims to conserve our bees by educating the public on their importance through our programs focused on community classes and events, public lectures, our Kids and Bees program, and our University program. The Bee Girl organization also facilitates the Farming for Bees initiative, empowering and recognizing land managers who provide habitat for our bees. Bee Girl engages with communities across the nation, and the globe, spreading knowledge and bringing a sense of wonder from the hive to the people.

http://www.beegirl.org/

Also thanks to

Holly Bushnell for the great artwork and support in creating both of these games. She is an amazing artist and has so much potential, we encourage you all to pop over to Holly's website and give it a look.

www.hollybushnelldesigns.co.uk

Feral Games who gave their time and skills in designing the games, and all for free. They are a small independent games company and it was amazing having them offer their skills for absolutely nothing. Thanks so much.

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/groups/feralgames/

Twitter - @feralgamesinc

So with your help we can not only help children get in touch with nature but also help out all these worthwhile charities.

Please Pledge your support today.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tim Blewitt, and in October 2014 I ventured to Brussels, Belgium to attend the highly selective international theatre program Ecole Internationale de Theatre Lassaad.  I attended this school for one and a half years and improved my education on physical theatre, movement, anatomy, and improvisation by utilizing observations of the natural world in order to become a movement specialist in the most theatrical sense possible.

My campaign is to help me finish the FINAL TRIMESTER of this program so that I may have the opportunity to fully immerse myself in the entire curriculum of the Lassaad pedagogy.  Without the final installment of this pedagogy, my education in this field will not be nearly as satisfying, and will always feel incomplete to me.  If you are able to contribute to my campaign, you will not only help me to finish one of my most passionate dreams of attending this school, but you will also enhance my education as a serious theatre practitioner.

What I Need & What You Get

In order to pay the tuition of the final trimester, I need $1,000 dollars.  All of this money will go directly to The Lassaad School for tuition.

In return for your contribution, I will send you a picture of myself in the city of Brussels applying one of the many physical/theatrical elements that I have been learning at the school.

The Impact

As one of my teachers explained to me at the school, "Everything we do in life is interesting."  Every movement we make, every action we take, has a cause, a purpose, and an effect.  The education that I am receiving now has truly revolutionized the way that I look at human interaction, and the way that I behold the beauty of everyday life.  Your contribution will allow me to continue on this path of ever-improving my perspective of natural life, in addition to helping me specialize my continuously growing craft of theatre performance.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, I appreciate your taking the time to read about my campaign.  If I could ask you to take just a few minutes more to share this campaign with friends and family  --  anyone who might be able to help  --  it would make a world of difference to me.  Thank you so much, and I look forward to sharing my adventures with you!

story:
UNO MUNDO

A Humanitarian Retreat 

by Love Extends

Who We Are


    Hola! My name is Derek Racine, dreamer and founder of Love Extends and Uno Mundo. We are creating a place of peace, education, growth, inspiration, health, relaxation, self and community realization, with an emphasis on LOVE, through socio-cultural exchange and humanitarian efforts in Leon, Nicaragua.  

What is "Uno Mundo"

    This humanitarian retreat is in a beautiful jungle setting, just outside Leon, a quaint, colonial, university city in Nicaragua. Our purpose is to provide eye opening, mind opening and heart opening travel experiences to guests, while the profits serve the community thru outreach, humanitarian projects, programs, events, classes and other activities. Our goal is to provide our guests with an immersive cultural experience that respects the local traditions and has a sustainable and positive impact on the communities surrounding "Uno Mundo".

     The location of this space is less than 8 miles from two humble, yet accommodating and relaxing beach towns, with great surfing, fishing, sea turtle preservations, mangrove expeditions, restaurants, bars, hostels, camping areas, rental establishments, sunsets and more. We are also only 2 miles from Leon itself.

   Also in the immediate area there is volcano hiking and boarding, horseback riding, zip lining,  great restaurants and entertainment, historical tours provided by living revolutionaries (Sandanistas) and indigenous tribesmen, museums, protected areas, sacred grounds and so much more.  Again, our purpose is to offer something undeniably beautiful and fulfilling to guests, while our profits and presence serve the community.

Inspiration

    This vision was inspired by my experience working with Latin American orphans, impoverished communities and finding the ideal to serve something greater than myself and provide to those in greater need than myself. Throughout my journey in exploring and confirming this chosen path, I've learned to listen to the needs of the local communities that I have been working with. Uno Mundo has many principles and purposes, such as:
1. Creating a positive impact on the community, economy and health of Nicaragua through humanitarian voluntourism.
2. Offering a mindful travel destination that is sustainable, employs locals, honors and informs visitors of local and global cultures, and offers a safe, inexpensive and immersive experience.

3. Working directly with orphans, street children, impoverished and abused children and their families.

4. Inspiring all global community members to fearlessly live with passion and purpose, art and awareness, connection and compassion, healing and hope, and love and light!
    If we are to support and contribute to a community, we must first understand it and it's issues. The understanding I have gained in my  travels, research and meetings with more experienced philanthropists than myself, has transformed this vision into the financially sustainable design of "Uno Mundo". As the nature of voluntourism exposes people to a place and culture that they can either help or harm, we will take honor in facilitating a more respectful and responsible exchange. Since tourism is a necessity in some areas such as this, Uno Mundo's goal is not to interrupt the local economy or culture, but rather to extend ourselves to it in order to strengthen it. Through our mindful operations, we will contribute socially, and with the profits and programs recycling back into the community, our presence will have multiple layers of positive effect.

The Property

        

       

    The property is turn key with a face lift, so the purchase price includes all accommodations and amenities that an eco resort would require. With some cleaning, painting, landscaping and minimal repair, we can open for business and begin sharing ourselves with the community. 
    This opportunity came to us through a blend of human intention and divine intervention, which is the energy we seek to spread and sustain. The land has been developed and includes:
 -75+ person hostel which entails 5 large dorm rooms with full bathrooms
-1 private suite (4 person or less)
-large communal kitchen (centrally located)
-private pool and patio
-2 recreation rooms
-Large covered outdoor area with bar, study, garden 
-Guest house with sanctuary. 
-4 pools 
-Auditorium
-Patio style restaurant
-Additional amenities include picnic areas, playgrounds, pavilions, patios, ponds, gardens, water fountains, a fresh spring creek, wild life, fruit trees and in the future tree houses, cabanas, farm/ocean/tree to table restaurant and more. 

       

    Much excitement comes from the fact that we are purchasing a fully operational property with no further costs outside of the potential expansion! Uno Mundo will be able to open immediately after obtaining the property.

Building Community Bridges

     We will have international volunteers and local staff sharing responsibilities with daily operations and with standard minimum wage at $1/ hr, we can immediately offer better wages, resulting in higher quality staff and a higher quality of life for employees. We also have ample space to house staff if necessary. The facilities and ambience lend itself to group retreats, events and festivals as well. It has an energy for retreats such as yoga, family, couples, healing, surfing, and a variety of others. I can envision daily/hourly events such as weddings, quinceneras, birthdays, reunions, holiday parties, barbecues, corporate and more. In fact, part of the property was a family park and restaurant that the entire community already knows, loves and respects. It closed down two years ago, as family ownership moved on and now it just awaits a fresh direction, a little funding and some good energy.

Why Leon, Nicaragua?

                   

    Central American tourism directly influences the strength of the economy. Tourism is the second largest industry in Nicaragua. President Ortega has publicly shown his support in growing this sector in order to reduce poverty throughout the country. 
    Although Nicaragua is the poorest country in all of Latin American, it has also been ranked the safest Latin American country according to many sources, including Interpol. Regardless of these facts, tourism in Nicaragua has the greatest potential for growth through its resources, policies, and overall market climate. Leon has points of interest including ancient ruins, architectural tours, eco tours, surf breaks, market places, volcanos and the city itself.
    Ecotourism, agrotourism, voluntourism, adventure tourism and Central American tourism steadily and aggressively climb year after year.  Nicaraguan tourism has consistently grown at a rate of 10%-16% per year over the past 7 years exceeding the Latin American averages.  This growth is due in part to a diversified range of travel options in a safe environment, accessibility, national economic direction, with an unbelievable price tag. Our property is also a microcosm of that, with no direct competitors. 
    Within Nicaragua, Leon is a well traveled destination for its safe, clean, culturally and historically rich city. It's a gateway to two of the more relaxing yet accommodating beach towns, with good surf and many activities. There are many volcano hiking tours and one that's become quite popular is volcano boarding! The market analysis shows how a foreign investment of this nature, in this area would not only be secure, but beneficial for both investors and the community.
    Round trip flights from California and New York are currently in the $400 range, although I'm sure the time of year has its influence. Prices you can expect down here are often jaw droppingly low. For example; breakfast $2-4, lunch $2-7, dinner $3 and up (there are nice restaurants for fine dining), taxis to town $1-4, public transit 20 cents to town 40 cents to beach, bus from Managua to Leon $2, local dorm room bed $5-8/ night, local private hostel room for 4 people or less $25-35/ night, local hotel room $40 and up, beer $1.25-2, coffee <$1, smoothies $1-3. The fish, fruit, vegetables and usually meat are always fresh, not to mention the air. Wifi is available almost everywhere these days and even at Uno Mundo. Nicaragua offers an unrivaled cost of traveling/living (for what its worth), allowing travelers to experience everything while staying well within their traveling budget.

Nicaraguan Land and Business Investment Climate

    The Nicaraguan government and President Ortega have legislatively encouraged, supported and incentivized foreign investment on a globally recognized scale. For all tourism related businesses there is a 10 year, 100% tax exemption on property, income, import/export, sales and more, with a probability of a ten year extension. Currently tourism is the 2nd largest industry in Nicaragua with regulations and incentives maintaining a steady, yet astounding growth.  Furthermore, it positively impacts agriculture and development, which are currently the first and third largest industries. The timely support of the Nicaraguan government itself is directly in line with the launch of Uno Mundo.

Funding "Uno Mundo"

    The initial start up cost is only the mortgage plus $5000 for the necessities to open. We can open for business almost immediately and begin sharing the goals of Uno Mundo with the community!
    We currently have approximately $60,000 invested in this project and only need about $35,000 to purchase the land and all facilities except for the hostel and guest house. It has been negotiated as an owner financed, balloon payment deal and with a substantial financial loss of money owed to me just after closing, I am reaching out to our supporters to help us reach our goal. The funds are going directly to purchase the property and to provide the perks listed for direct donations.  As for the two hostel buildings, I am renting those for $500/month in order to secure a future purchase of $80,000. We can and will function as an owner/renter business until our profits accumulate and other arrangements are made in order to assume ownership of both properties. There are also a few hidden costs, such as; filing for residency, filing for business, lawyer fees, and a few more. Although the costs are minimal, transparency is of the utmost importance to us, so that supporters are fully aware of how the funding is being distributed.

Skills and Experience

    I have been an enthusiast of many things throughout my life. As the visionary of this project I've realized how essential a diverse and specific skill set will be in the realization of such an endeavor. Unbeknownst to me at the time, I began acquiring fully applicable skills and experience for this venture, at a very young age, working on the family campground. I would later gain 20 more years of experience within the hospitality and food business. Beginning with entry level positions and working my way up through management, has given me a thorough understanding of the necessary mechanisms of hospitality operations. It has also given me a sense of what each staff member may be facing or feeling based on their position, in order to better facilitate responsibilities. Combined with an educational background in socio-cultural anthropology, recent travels to and integration into the local community, and intermediate Spanish skills, I am confident in my abilities to plan, train, supervise and overall manage such an endeavor. I also have adequate experience in commercial farming, construction (many trades), teaching and coaching (sports, arts, academic subjects, etc), community organizing, event planning, and child care. The experiences I've had working with Latin American orphans has certainly been the most useful and inspirational components to the vision and its future success. 

    Through the years, a very dedicated and diverse group of people have entered my life, enhanced it and continue to support it. Onboard supporters include professionals and enthusiasts from just about every field imaginable! Some will help finance, others volunteer. Some will volunteer on site and others, their services and wisdom from their place of residence. All in all, we have just about every resource possible, so right now the goal is to pool and activate them, with funding taking priority to secure the property! 
               Risks and Challenges

- The main challenge is acquiring the remaining start up costs. Many foreigners are hesitant to invest in Nicaragua due to misleading propaganda over the years and an unfamiliar business atmosphere, but I assure you it's secure, growing and has many incentives.  

- There are many other hotels and hostels in the area, though our design, approach and environment leave us without any direct competitors. 

- Balancing the personalities on site will be difficult. Passion driven work often creates an intense environment and with the exposure to some foreign realities, some people will be processing powerful feelings and thoughts with limited knowledge of how. Another aspect we are excited to guide and help with. 

- Our cultural differences must be observed and understood to make a solely positive impact on the community. This will require each guest to be conscious of their behavior while at the property and in public to ensure our humanitarian objectives of the future will be embraced by the locals. 

Donate For A Meaningful Perk
And Discover More Ways to Help
  Now I know this sounds cliche, but we need DONATIONS to reach our goal. We are so close to creating something so special, that will touch so many! We ask for whatever donation you are able to make, without over extending yourself, but also to extend this opportunity to as many as you can. Through sharing, reposting, tagging and talking, we are able to include those who are unaware that we exist, and sometimes that's all it takes! I humbly ask that you go the distance in spreading the word, and more importantly, extending the love. We are offering some very special perks to claim as a symbol of our gratitude and will continue to share our progress and experiences as our humanitarian efforts take form.
   

     Since I feel we've exhausted the structure/strategy/business aspects of the project, I'd like to invite everyone to come be a part of this, on location, beginning in July. This is my way of saying; if you have the time to contribute, the ideas to realize, the heart to help, the skills to share, the wisdom to bestow, the art to create, the courage to explore, the passion to connect or simply the desire to get away and vacation, then let me encourage, support and host such things. I welcome you  to come teach us and help us understand the things you do and that we may not. I offer opportunities to learn and grow through the different available participants, locals, partnering groups and the environment. I'm overly excited about hosting retreats and events, implementing programs and classes and possibly festivals, with the help of you all and the consent of the community, of course. We do ask everyone to make a basic agreement with themselves upon entry . We ask you to be open, considerate, positive, communicative, respectful, fun and fundamentally decent. For those of you volunteering or staying longer term, we up the anti and ask you to be an example of these things, as well as; inspiring, creative, healthy, conscious, artistic, supportive, compromising, understanding and most importantly loving, in only your way of course. 
    Our gratitude is far beyond words! And as we embark upon this epic, philanthropic adventure, I urge you to join us in creating and cultivating Uno Mundo to be the place it is destined to be! Always remember;

"Our deepest fear is not that we're inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light not our darkness that most frightens us. You're playing small does not serve the world. There is nothing enlightened about shrinking so that other people won't feel insecure around you. We are all meant to shine as children do. It's not just in some of us, it's in everyone. So as you let your own light shine, you unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. And as we liberate ourselves from our own fears, our presence automatically liberates others." poem by Marrianne Williamson inspired by Nelson Mandela
story_txt:
UNO MUNDOA Humanitarian Retreat by Love Extends
Who We Are
 

    Hola! My name is Derek Racine, dreamer and founder of Love Extends and Uno Mundo. We are creating a place of peace, education, growth, inspiration, health, relaxation, self and community realization, with an emphasis on LOVE, through socio-cultural exchange and humanitarian efforts in Leon, Nicaragua.  
What is "Uno Mundo"
    This humanitarian retreat is in a beautiful jungle setting, just outside Leon, a quaint, colonial, university city in Nicaragua. Our purpose is to provide eye opening, mind opening and heart opening travel experiences to guests, while the profits serve the community thru outreach, humanitarian projects, programs, events, classes and other activities. Our goal is to provide our guests with an immersive cultural experience that respects the local traditions and has a sustainable and positive impact on the communities surrounding "Uno Mundo".

     The location of this space is less than 8 miles from two humble, yet accommodating and relaxing beach towns,
with great surfing, fishing, sea turtle preservations, mangrove expeditions,
restaurants, bars, hostels, camping areas, rental establishments, sunsets and
more. We are also only 2 miles from Leon itself.
   Also in the
immediate area there is volcano hiking and boarding, horseback riding, zip
lining,  great restaurants and
entertainment, historical tours provided by living revolutionaries
(Sandanistas) and indigenous tribesmen, museums, protected areas, sacred grounds and
so much more.  Again, our purpose is to offer something undeniably beautiful and fulfilling to guests, while
our profits and presence serve the community.
Inspiration    This vision was inspired by my experience working with Latin American orphans, impoverished communities and finding the ideal to serve something greater than myself and provide to those in greater need than myself. Throughout my journey in exploring and confirming this chosen path, I've learned to listen to the needs of the local communities that I have been working with. Uno Mundo has many principles and purposes, such as:
1. Creating a positive impact on the community, economy and health of Nicaragua through humanitarian voluntourism.
2. Offering a mindful travel destination that is sustainable, employs locals, honors and informs visitors of local and global cultures, and offers a safe, inexpensive and immersive experience.3. Working directly with orphans, street children, impoverished and abused children and their families.
4. Inspiring all global community members to fearlessly live with passion and purpose, art and awareness, connection and compassion, healing and hope, and love and light!    If we are to support and contribute to a community, we must first understand it and it's issues. The understanding I have gained in my  travels, research and meetings with more experienced philanthropists than myself, has transformed this vision into the financially sustainable design of "Uno Mundo". As the nature of voluntourism exposes people to a place and culture that they can either help or harm, we will take honor in facilitating a more respectful and responsible exchange. Since tourism is a necessity in some areas such as this, Uno Mundo's goal is not to interrupt the local economy or culture, but rather to extend ourselves to it in order to strengthen it. Through our mindful operations, we will contribute socially, and with the profits and programs recycling back into the community, our presence will have multiple layers of positive effect.The Property
        
       
    The property is turn key with a face lift, so the purchase price includes all accommodations and amenities that an eco resort would require. With some cleaning, painting, landscaping and minimal repair, we can open for business and begin sharing ourselves with the community.     This opportunity came to us through a blend of human intention and divine intervention, which is the energy we seek to spread and sustain. The land has been developed and includes: -75+ person hostel which entails 5 large dorm rooms with full bathrooms-1 private suite (4 person or less)-large communal kitchen (centrally located)-private pool and patio-2 recreation rooms-Large covered outdoor area with bar, study, garden -Guest house with sanctuary. -4 pools -Auditorium-Patio style restaurant
-Additional amenities include picnic areas, playgrounds, pavilions, patios, ponds, gardens, water fountains, a fresh spring creek, wild life, fruit trees and in the future tree houses, cabanas, farm/ocean/tree to table restaurant and more. 
       
    Much excitement comes from the fact that we are purchasing a fully operational property with no further costs outside of the potential expansion! Uno Mundo will be able to open immediately after obtaining the property.
Building Community Bridges
     We will have international volunteers and local staff sharing responsibilities with daily operations and with standard minimum wage at $1/ hr, we can immediately offer better wages, resulting in higher quality staff and a higher quality of life for employees. We also have ample space to house staff if necessary. The facilities and ambience lend itself to group retreats, events and festivals as well. It has an energy for retreats such as yoga, family, couples, healing, surfing, and a variety of others. I can envision daily/hourly events such as weddings, quinceneras, birthdays, reunions, holiday parties, barbecues, corporate and more. In fact, part of the property was a family park and restaurant that the entire community already knows, loves and respects. It closed down two years ago, as family ownership moved on and now it just awaits a fresh direction, a little funding and some good energy. Why Leon, Nicaragua?                   
    Central American tourism directly influences the strength of the economy. Tourism is the second largest industry in Nicaragua. President Ortega has publicly shown his support in growing this sector in order to reduce poverty throughout the country. 

    Although Nicaragua is the poorest country in all of Latin American, it has also been ranked the safest Latin American country according to many sources, including Interpol. Regardless of these facts, tourism in Nicaragua has the greatest potential for growth through its resources, policies, and overall market climate. Leon has points of interest including ancient ruins, architectural tours, eco tours, surf breaks, market places, volcanos and the city itself.

    Ecotourism, agrotourism, voluntourism, adventure tourism and Central American tourism steadily and aggressively climb year after year.  Nicaraguan tourism has consistently grown at a rate of 10%-16% per year over the past 7 years exceeding the Latin American averages.  This growth is due in part to a diversified range of travel options in a safe environment, accessibility, national economic direction, with an unbelievable price tag.
